name: River Trips
address: Abha Saudi Arabia
text: A colleague and I had half a day in Jeddah city and we decided to visit the Old Town. I found a listing by Abha Trips and booked a slot. For some reason, even though I had booked it for morning, the app gave me a confirmation for evening. I contacted Dr. Osama regarding the same and he immediately sorted it out and gave us a morning tour. Muhammad was our guide for the day and he was extremely gracious, forthcoming and knowledagle about the city and it's history. We walked around the town at leisure while he explained the history and significance of the structures and the current restoration work. He also told us about the other places that we could visit in the city. We were looking to buy some perfumes and dates and he was extremely accomodating and took us to 3-4 different shops with a variety of products available. I highly recommend Abha Trips and Muhammad for your next trip to Jeddah if you wish to explore the city and understand it's history and culture. We had a great experience and are extremely happy with the service.
description_x: Abha trips was created for visitors to recognize the southern beauty of Saudi Arabia. Our tours are private because It's important to us to engage and create a personal connection because it makes the experience very authentic. We speak English fluently and we grew up learning the history of the region and culture.

name: Jawatha Park
address: Fmch+65q, Al Kulabiyah, Juatha 36353, Saudi Arabia, Al Ahsa 36353 Saudi Arabia
text:
A very popular theme park in Al Ahsa, beside the heritage Mosque (Masjid) Jawatha Masjid. 

The park has many rides and food stalls and many activities for all age groups. It's open in the evening time and the best time to go there is during Fridays and other public holidays. 

They have a lot of popular game activities for children of all age groups. 

It's a great place to hang out and relax. 

They have a prayer room at the entrance of the park.

The jawatha Masjid is also a great place to visit . The only problem is the masjid is closed to the public and the washrooms are closed as well. You can wash yourself at the park restrooms and pray outside the masjid near its entrance.  

I visited it during the day on a Friday and it was a beautiful place to be.

name: Palmarosa Wellness & Spa by L'Occitane
address: Al Malik Khalid Street InterContinental al Ahsa, Al Ahsa 31982 Saudi Arabia
text: One of the best clubs in the city of Al -Ahsa, where interest in health is to practice all sports, and the most important thing I liked is the cleanliness of the pool and the upscale service
description_x: A haven of relaxation and well-being, the Palmarosa SPA is the first L√¢¬Ä¬ôOCCITANE inspired spa in the Eastern Province to offer an exclusive selection of L√¢¬Ä¬ôOCCITANE en Provence treatments and therapies. Located on the ground floor of the hotel, it includes several treatment rooms, hammam facilities and relaxation rooms for both men and women. The spa offers a fully integrated and holistic well-being journey with a wide range of treatments using L√¢¬Ä¬ôOCCITANE's signature beauty products that are rich in natural and organic ingredients. The treatments offered to guests include the award-winning Aromachology Relaxing Massage inspired by Swedish effleurage, Balinese massage techniques and the Chinese tradition of acupressure. Premium health club facilities include a fully equipped gym with professional team of fitness instructors, an indoor pool, steam, sauna and a salon. With a wide range of spa treatments, melt all the stress away under the soothing hands the welcoming spa therapist.

text:
A beautiful shallow wet land lake located near to Al hasa, consisting of wet lands surrounded by Ferns and sand dunes with lots of migratory birds. 
Although the access to this location is difficult and needs a 4x4 suv, you will never regret visiting or forgetting this place.
Please note: you must reduce the tire air pressure of your 4x4 vehicle substantially before entering the desert.

name: Roman Theatre Uqair
address: Uqair, Al Hofuf, Al Ahsa Saudi Arabia
text: Travelled from Al Khobar ,approx 85 km to Uqair region for day out. First visited fort and palace at the historical port, then to the beach and pier area. We were surprised to see a road sign to Roman theater so went to discover and explore. The site is still under construction but gives lovely views across the coastline and hopefully when finished will be a great venue with water in the moat and toilet / refreshments on site. Glad we visited while in the area. No petrol stations, cafes, shops in the area and nearest toilet facilities we found were at the beach so take these into account when visiting the area.

name: Jawatha Mosque
address: Al Hofuf, Al Ahsa Saudi Arabia
text:
16th May 2013: We reached Jawatha Masjid by 4:15pm. It was in the middle of the desert. It was also closed but the door was not locked so we were able to open it. The ruins of the original masjid are not left. It has a small park around it. We spent half hour there.
Jawatha Mosque also incorrectly spelled Al-Jawana is located in the village of Al-Kilabiyah. It was the earliest mosque built in east Arabia. The site is still used for prayer. 

Ticket: Free
Time Required: 15min
Coordinates: 25.470244,49.677086

name: Nirvana Spa and Fitness Centre
address: 3266 Custodian of Two Holy Mosques Road Grand Hyatt Al Khobar Hotel and Residences, Al Khobar 31952 Saudi Arabia
text: I received excellent service. The staff member Wasim was very kind and attentive, making my experience enjoyable and stress-free.
description_x:
Nirvana Spa is a luxurious space with 6 treatment rooms for women and 4 for men, offering a full range of body treatments, facials and massages. At Nirvana Spa, we have a modern and fully equipped Fitness Center, along with a Health Club that offers whirlpool baths, sauna, steam rooms and Moroccan bath. At Nirvana, there are separate swimming pools for men and women, featuring mood lighting and relaxation beds. Kids can access the swimming pool from Thursday to Saturday during the operating hours, and from Sunday to Wednesday during 9:00am - 6:00pm. Nirvana Spa has been awarded by the World Luxury Spa Awards in 2022, 2023, and 2024.
In 2024, Nirvana Spa was honored as one of the Top 100 Spas of the World by Luxury Lifestyle Awards.

name: King Fahd Grand Mosque
address: King Fahd Road, Al Khobar 34626 Saudi Arabia
text: The mosque is situated in a large garden facing the Khobar Corniche consisting of two prayer halls on a land area of 40,000 square meters. There are two minarets, about 49 meters high, on both sides of the main entrance. A distinctly Saudi architectural design, it is dominated by the character of the modern era with all its induction technology. With multiple entrances, it is widely known as a very spacious and one of the largest mosques in the Eastern Province with a capacity of 4,100 worshippers. Completed in May 1997 at a cost of over Saudi Riyals 24,610,000 (over $6,500,000) it is a good and clean masjid, featuring a separate women's section, wheelchair accessibility, a big ablution area, clean toilets, and a large parking area. The big park is generally used for walking, cycling, picnicking, and a playing area for kids. It is a monument in Khobar city. Close to this mosque are many civic facilities including a hypermarket, petrol station, fast food, restaurants, banks and ATM machines, etc. Adjacent to the mosque is a funeral home or mortuary where the last rituals of a dead person are held. Usually, the janaza (funeral) prayers are offered here and then the deceased is taken to the Thuqbah graveyard.

name: Market
address: King Faisal Ibn Abd Al Aziz, , Al Bustan Al Bustan, Al Khobar 34422 Saudi Arabia
text: We regularly visit this store due to its quality products and fresh produce. Mercato is a supermarket that offers a wide variety of items and can fulfill all your basic needs. They have an impressive selection of products, and the staff is always helpful and friendly. The pastries are particularly noteworthy, as they are incredibly delicious. The store is well organized and clean, with fresh products and good offers. The deli counter and bakery are especially nice, and the bakery items are freshly prepared. The store is medium-sized and neat, with a well-arranged layout. The ambiance and setup are both excellent, making for an enjoyable shopping experience.  Their falafel is a must-try item! The food is fresh, and there are lots of promotions available, making for a reasonable price point. Overall, Mercato is a fantastic supermarket that offers fresh fruits and vegetables, a variety of household consumables, and great food options.

name: Tamimi Markets
address: Corniche Road & Prince Turkey Street, Al Khobar 34427 Saudi Arabia
text: Operating 24 hours 7 days a week, Tamimi Markets has become the preferred place to shop, even at odd hours, for our kitchen and home requirements and a great majority of locals and expatriates. Tamimi Group's collaboration with Safeway in the 1980s brought Tamimi Markets to Saudi Arabia. They've since become a rapidly growing supermarket chain, consistently ranking as a Top 100 Saudi Brand. Their success is rooted in unwavering customer service, quality, freshness, variety, and competitive pricing, making them a leading shopping mall. Its spacious, well-stocked stores offer a wide range of local and regional brands, including top-quality produce, meats, seafood, cheeses, and household products. Sheikh Ali Abdullah Al Tamimi founded the Tamimi Group in 1953 to support Saudi Arabia's growing oil and manufacturing industries. This move brought international standards and high-quality food products to Saudi consumers, reshaping the retail landscape in the country. At present, they have expanded to over 90 locations in Saudi Arabia.

description_x: A family run business since 1990, Desert Designs has grown manifold from the store opened in a desert tent, to its flagship storefront on King Abdullah Street in Al Khobar, Saudi Arabia. Come Visit Us and browse our vast collection of personally curated products, ranging from tribal Bedouin arts brought especially for you from the desert, to modern executive gifts always created keeping the heritage of Islamic design in the forefront. Artists and Artisans are both given equal importance at Desert Designs. Host to its own contemporary art gallery, we continue to provide a platform for both upcoming and known local artists. And then there is Cafea Arab, offering gourmet coffees and teas both hot and cold, to complete your ultimate shopping experience. OUR MISSION Create and promote culture, art, heritage and design through our space, products and services. OUR VISION Inspiring cultural value within your lifestyle. BRAND PROMISE Fusing Culture and Design.

text: A large meeting chamber carved out of the rock, chosen in part because it is sited in the near-permanent shade where two rock faces meet. There‚Äôs evidence that many different religions used the site concurrently, and that tribes gathered here to discuss the business of the day.
description_x: Religious or ritual practices at Hegra were concentrated around Jabal Ithlib, a natural mountain outcrop to the east of the city. A special feature is a rock-cut chamber known as the Diwan, where ritual or elite banqueting and political discussions took place.

description_x: Once a place of nearly 900 homes, 400 shops and 5 town squares, much of the Old Town of AlUla√¢¬Ä¬ôs mudbrick and stone architecture still survives today. A citadel perched on a prominent outcrop along the eastern edge is still accessible via a restored staircase. Those interested in history will be delighted to discover that this site was occupied within recent memory, offering unique opportunities to gather and share oral histories encapsulating a disappearing way of life.

text:
An area of outstanding beauty which can be seen from a long distance all around AlUla.
No wonder the nabathean chose this spot for as their holy place
description_x: In the heart of Hegra, Saudi Arabia first UNESCO world heritage site a spectacular landscape named by Jabal Ithlib, a natural mountain outcrop to the east of the city.

name: Lion Tombs of Dadan
address: AlUla Saudi Arabia
text:
Guided tour in the green valley below the Lion Tombs (which you only see from a distance in the mountain side - looking glasses available for free). 
In 2020 only 4% of this area influenced by an early civilization was excavated!
description_x: Lions symbolised power and protection in the capital of the Dadan and Lihyan kingdoms, and may have marked the burial of an elite member of society, perhaps even a member of royalty. These tombs are up to 50 metres above ground level.

name: Dadan & Jabal Ikmah
address: AlUla Saudi Arabia
text:
AlUla tourism has a problem with how they deal with tourists. They have decided that either you pay for a guided bus tour which gives you extremely limited time to see the sights, or you pay too much money to be shepherded around in a "vintage Land Rover" (as if anyone cares about what kind of car drives you to a heritage site) for the same amount of time, but without the other people. 
The experience of Dadan, in all honesty, was a joke. You cannot get close enough to see the only thing of interest at this site. So if you didn't bring your own binoculars, you can share the four provided on site with everyone else. The road is just behind you, you have exactly the same experience from the road. Then, after spending a full three minutes being told about the lions, you are hurried over to play in a sandbox. Twenty minutes. Grown adults who have travelled across the world to see the history of this place were given more time to pretend to dig up pottery than to learn about the site. 
Then you're driven three feet over to see the archaeological site where you're shown photos of the same archaeological site. 

Jabal Ikmah was better, the engravings and the site itself are astonishing. It was a real pleasure to discover this place and the thousands of years of history it represents. However, once again, be ready to be herded off again way too soon. 
After this visit you're given chisels and a rock and can carve some shapes if you're interested. It was actually quite fun at the end of the visit, however the fact that they factor in these kinds of activities that no one asked for into the time and price is frustrating and felt rather infantilising.
description_x: An open air library across AlUla's Valley, lie thousands of inscriptions in Aramaic, Dadanitic, Thamudic, Minaic and Nabataean, features one of the oldest inscriptions of the Islamic era dating back to 24AH (644 CE).

text: Clear communication about the trail before the ticket is sold not after. Adventure trail- hiking boots a must. Walk is a lot of boulders with no break. My phone worked but guides didn't becausecI had a global Sim card.  That's a safety issue that needs to be fixed.
description_x: Husaak is the leading adventure tour operator in the Gulf. Established in 2013 in Oman, the business expanded to Saudi Arabia in 2020 launching a range of outdoor experiences in the historic area of AlUla.

name: Al Ula
address: Al Takhassusi street, AlUla 12333 Saudi Arabia
text: When we planned to visit Al Ula we decided to stay here for three nights, but it would have been better to stay a little longer. We arrived here by car, which is essential for a complete and independent visit. The main reason tourists come here is Hegra, which alone is worth a visit than Al Ula. We booked the visits to Dadan & Jabal Ikmah and the Old Town online. For the first one, as well as for Hegra, we parked in Winter park while for the second one we used the Old Town North Parking although we can also confirm that Old Town South Parking is closer to the starting point of the tour. The walking tour of the oasis (oasis trail) can be started from several points even if we have considered the best solution to use the car parking located on the other side of the road at the south end of the Old Town.  Among the things to do at sunset without a doubt Elephant Rock and the Harrat viewpoint are unmissable. Al Ula offers many other opportunities for visits and recreation and among them Rainbow Rock and Maraya cannot fail to be mentioned for its uniqueness. Finally, although now temporarily closed, work has begun to expand and repopulate the Sharaan Nature Reserve where in addition to the present animals (red-necked ostriches, regal Nubian ibex, gazelles and Cape hare) the leopard will be reintroduced. We cannot fail to report the kindness and courtesy of those who live here (who have always supported us with information and suggestions), the ease of movement with car and parking and the absolute safety of this town whose only negative aspect (at least one there must be) are the speed cameras. Unmissable and the most interesting place for anyone visiting Saudi Arabia.
description_x: On the rocks of AlUla, its geography, its history and its walls, and the stories behind them. Where the adventure in the mountains of AlUla and discover its peaks and discover civilizations that existed thousands of years ago. The pillars carved by nature among the trees and in the middle of the desert cleave the sky with its glory, and birds of prey flutter around it.

name: Rainbow Rock
address: 375 Hwy., AlUla 43726 Saudi Arabia
text: Part of the environs around Al Ula.  A natural sandstone formation etched out by erosion like the Elephant Rock.  Did not see any tourists around and certainly no tourist facilities nearby.  When I was there one was able to climb up to the top of the Rock.

name: Harrat Viewpoint
address: Harrat Viewpoint, AlUla Saudi Arabia
text: As a photographer this spot is magical. Only 30 minutes drive out of town - you can easily go early evening when ir is cooler and the light is warm and inviting. There was almost no one when I was there (July is not long on tourists) - so a tranquil beautiful experience. I did not eat or drink and, in fact, am not even sure the restaurant was open. Do visit!
description_x: Harrat Viewpoint is an outdoor seating area and outlook at the top of Harrat Uwayrid. Free to all, visitors are welcome to stay for as little or as long as they would like. Children of all ages are welcome.

name: Ikmah mountain
address: Ikmah mountain, AlUla Saudi Arabia
text: During day time you can see Nabatean scripts on the mountain, at night there is after dark activity where you can have your name scripted on a rock then a projector show of the history of the mountain

name: Al Ula Oasis Trail
address: Rd 375 - Lat 26.627918, Long 37.916806, AlUla Saudi Arabia
text:
Right through the valley in Al Ula it is green with date palms and various other crops.
In amongst this they have established a signposted walking trail where you stroll through the oasis and see how they grow the date palms and also get a glimpse into village life Saudi style.
It is free to do and the entrance is just down from "Somewhere Cafe" near the old town.
If you have 1-2 hours and enjoy a leisurely stroll this is well worth your time.

name: Madain Saleh Tours

Peace be upon you and God's mercy and blessings

Welcome...
Welcome to the officials...

Sorry for the evaluation, I would have liked 5 stars.

Honestly, I don't know what the secretariat lacks in terms of experience, engineers and knowledge about the existence of many patches of grass that are not suitable for sitting. I mean, there is a parks administration. What have they provided for this place in terms of treatment and follow-up? There is a high amount of visual distortion in the park from dry grass, dilapidated sidewalks, holes and neglected trees.

The bathrooms, may God bless you, are almost non-existent and dirty and need complete maintenance.

Young people mingle with families.

The games need maintenance, washing and cleaning.

Why can't the park be a model? Where is the supervisor and where is the official?!!

What do you lack in terms of ideas, creativity and activation of the parks?

If you had held the facility for a living, you would have ruined it with violations.

The most failed idea for parks is entry fees.

While exploiting activities such as horse racing, swimming pools, amusement parks, grocery stores, cafes, restaurants, etc. ...
All for a symbolic rent and the proceeds go to developing the facility.

In short, every garden or park is a project that an office, employee, or company is responsible for. After structuring and designing it with a creative, exemplary design.

And every park competes with the other and surpasses it with better services than the other.

I hope for a kind gesture to these facilities, as they are a breathing space for middle-income and modest families.. I came to have fun and ended up with an inappropriate place and dozens of cats.

I have a lot up my sleeve, but this is what I wanted to offer for the renaissance in my country's breathing spaces üá∏üá¶.

And God is the Grantor of success.

name: Omar Bin Al-Khattab Mosque
address: Dumah Al Jandal Saudi Arabia
text:
It is also known as Umar ibn Al-Khattab mosque or Al-Khattab Mosque.
The mosque is located in the heart of the ancient city of Dumat al-Jandal, while the Islamic caliph Omar Bin Al-Khattab passes by Dahumat al-Jandal, who has returned from Jerusalem. Apparently they ordered it to be built in. The mosque's grounds are almost rectangular and extend from west to east. It is 32.5 meters long and 18 meters wide. There are two places to worship, one with winter walls and doors, and the main location is two rows of stone pillars that support the roof. There is a courtyard between the two. It was built between 634 and 644 and is famous for its attractive stone minaret, approximately 12.7 meters tall.
The mosque happened to be open and we had a special tour. It has been repaired and appears to be in use today.
Next to the mosque is Marid Castle, and on the other side is Al Dar'i Quarter.
/ Daumat Al-Jundal Market.

name: At-Turaif
address: Wadi Hanifah, Diryah 13711 Saudi Arabia
text:
A magnificent, wonderful place! Here you need to come closer to sunset so that it is not hot, and here you can spend several hours. This is the former capital of Saudi Arabia, the place where the Saudi family built a clay palace in the 17th century, in which she lived before the attack of the Turks-Sosmans in 1818. There were the ruins of the palace and the buildings belonging to it - the mosque, the madrasah - school, Hamamma -Bani.
In addition, there is a museum of Arab horse, a small, but modern, and museum of Arab weapons inside. 
And at the end of the trip, a surprise awaits you - a real Bedouin village, where Arab boys play right on the street, the calls are called in the Arab market, where the artisans are sitting, and you will even take a free (so far) photo in a beautiful surroundings.
And then the night falls to the city, and you will go home along the old streets and can go on a fairy tale! 
It‚Äôs not necessary to go home at once, because on the way to the exit you will be met by a tourist zone with a mass of cafe, where you can sit and admire beautiful views, because the fortress is highlighted!
description_x: Inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2010, the historic district of At-Turaif overlooks Wadi Hanifah and the Diriyah oasis. Constructed from mudbrick in the Najdi style as a palatial royal citadel, this storied urban quarter became the capital of the Emirate of Diriyah or the First Saudi State (1727-1818), laying the foundations for what would eventually become the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

name: Angawi House
address: 3111 Sameer Bin Kaeb Ash Shanti, Jeddah 23412 Saudi Arabia
text:
I did a lot of research into Angawi House on my recent visit to Jeddah.
The house is privately owned and lived in by Dr Sami Angawi and his family.
Dr Angawi was born in Mecca and is an authority on Saudi Arabian architecture. The house is called Al Makkiyah and was 10 years in the making.
Dr Angawi built his house according to the wind. Capturing the wind from the north to the west, the house uses natural ventilation for half  of the year, throughout  different levels, limiting the need for air conditioning 
The house is constructed from many locally sourced materials. Dr Angawi‚Äôs wife Amira is an interior designer and whenever you see interior photographs of the house, you can see just how talented she is.
I discovered that the house is only available for visits and viewing at particular times and for group tours.
There was no such opportunity when I was in Jeddah, other than admiring the exterior of the house.
The research I did allowed me to discover that when there are opportunities for visits to the house the tickets cost around 200 riyals, which I believe includes tea being served to you.
It is difficult to find information on how you obtain tickets to see the house, if indeed this is still possible.
I would have loved to see the interior of this architectural masterpiece
description_x: Angawi House is a unique architectural landmark in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, designed by the renowned architect Dr. Sami Angawi. It is a stunning example of Hijazi architecture, blending traditional Islamic design with modern elements.

After completing my Rescue Diver course in Jeddah last year, it was wonderful to return and spend a fantastic trip with Walid. The dives with the octopus were particularly amazing.
The trip was incredibly simple for a lone diver thanks to the well-run, amiable, and productive crew.
I sincerely appreciate Walid for the enjoyable dives, and I can't wait to return the following year with my daughter to show her some of these incredible dives.

text:
My child and I are regular goers here. All is well. The Filipinas at the booth are always kind and friendly. Although there was one instance, there was a different attendant at the booth (female saudi), it was just around 10pm, they are not closing yet but very strict. My son and I are playing with these little balls and she said I should not throw the balls, I wasnt even throwing it outside the pit, but throwing it on my son. Another instance, I was feeding my child with her milk bottle, and we sat in the ball pit, there was not much kids there like maybe 2 or 3 but not in our area and she asked us to move away from that area. I was taking a video of my daughter and she told me she will pass as she wants to clean the balls (she doesnt want to be caught in the video).

C'mon that is a playing area, to enjoy and have fun. I was really in bad mood that day because of that. We finished early and didnt consume the 1hour I paid.

I hope they add more playing options for toddlers/babies. Nonetheless I will still go there.

name: ŸÖÿ±ŸÉÿ≤ ND KIDS ŸÑŸÑÿ™ÿ±ŸÅŸäŸá
address: King Abdallah Rdÿå ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÑŸäŸÖ ÿ®ŸÑÿßÿ≤ÿß, Jeddah 22253, Saudi Arabia
text:
This play area has the potential to be nice. The bottom floor has a trampoline area and a swing area that works as an obstacle coarse. The upstairs area has a coffee bar, a selection of kids toys that can be used sitting at the table as well as a sandbox and ball pit.

Unfortunately, the lady at the front desk is rude and apathetic. She barely looked up from her phone long enough to speak to me. Worst than that‚Ä¶ the place is a safety hazard!

I found a large screw fallen on the floor in the play area! It had obviously fallen into the play area where one of the walls was falling, leaving a giant opening leading to the cement floor under the trampoline. When I showed the employe that my child could fall through and hit the floor, she did nothing and continued sitting on her phone.

The steps leading up to the play area are NOT secured. It detached and rolled when I stepped on it, hitting my leg and causing me to trip, almost falling and dropping my child. It also left me with a bleeding leg and a giant bruise. When I spoke to the lady, her paraphrased response was ‚Äúwhat do you want me to do I‚Äôm just an employee‚Äù. I told her to call her manager and request a worker come to secure the step and fix the fallen wall. She only went to fix the fallen wall after I mentioned liability and reporting the place to the correct authority.

It‚Äôs unfortunate because the place could have been a nice place. I wouldn‚Äôt come again unless the customer service improves and the safety concerns are addressed. I also wouldn‚Äôt drive more than ten minutes to reach here. It is ok if you live nearby and your kids are bored of their regular spots, but again, not with the current customer service and safety hazards.

The maid Rashida was kind and attentive to the children, which I appreciate.

text:
Visited Saturday night. Lot of cons than pros.
1. Parking: Not easy to find. Overly crowded and far away with lot of walk. There are golf carts available from parking to the venue but super expensive 20SAR per adult.
2. Money minting : From the start till end, you can have a feeling , there is a desire to rob people off their money. Too many games and rides with overly priced tickets. Less or almost zero free entertainment but more  expensive games/rides.
3. If you have time, better to visit Riyadh ( Boulevard World & City), which is 100 times better and value for money.
4. Very limited places to sit (as one get tired)

text: I recently visited Daz Kids Playground, and I strongly advise others to reconsider their choice. Despite charging 89 SAR for a mere 2 hours, half of the playground is either broken, closed, or looks abandoned. When approached, the staff seemed indifferent and directed me to their unresponsive manager. It's disheartening to see employees expressing their concerns about missing toys, yet seeing no action taken. Expecting patrons to pay full price for a facility that is clearly not maintained or fully functional is unjust. The cleanliness is also questionable, adding to the disappointment. As of August 2023, this playground feels more like a scam than a place of fun. Save your money and time by considering other options.

It took a while to schedule this family visit and then it took a while to get there, due to the traffic and when we did, we were surprised to find a number of the rides were not working: the carousel, the ice skating rink and the terminator to name but a few. My son is 128cm, so could not go on most of the rides, which start at 130cm. He was able to ride on the baby bumper cars, the water bumper cars and the big slide, which are designed for younger children. He is 9, but short for his age, but overall, he found those rides ok. He had been looking forward to ice skating, so was sad to find that the rink had turned into a seating area. Many of the indoor games were also not working. My son did get a chance to climb the climbing wall, which was good. What we found most frustrating, was that the rides (and not the food stalls) closed during prayer and we had nothing to do for 30 minutes.  The park looks like it has not been renovated for over 10 years, with red/white tape placed on games, and doors that are no longer working. It really needs a revamp. There used to be a fountain but that was not working during our visit either. Will not be returning unless the place makes some real changes and please fix up your website Happy Land, it provides no information.

address: Old Makkah Rd Al-Balad, Jeddah Saudi Arabia
text: Bab Mecca Gate. It is one of the castle gates built during the Mamluk period in Egypt. It is a castle gate built on the road leading to Mecca. From outside the castle, a cylinder-like fortress is built on both sides of the castle gate, and it is a place where you can attack enemies from outside. At night, the gates were closed tightly and Jeddah was defended. It is said that hundreds of millions of pilgrims have passed through this gate from Jeddah over the past 14 centuries to Mecca. The current castle gates have been rebuilt.

address: Al Kurnaysh Br Rd Park Along The Jeddah Corniche, Jeddah Saudi Arabia
text:
The famous sculptures have been removed from the park at the Corniche, only empty platforms are left. Other sculptures have been placed along the corniche, but they are not labeled and, except for one, are not the original ones from the park. However, we happened to find some of them (Calder, Miro, Moore, Vaserely) in a different park near the Old Jeddah Gate. 

This niew location is not mentioned in guidebooks or even the official tourism brochures issued by the city. The green park where they are now located is very well maintained, and the sculptures are well integrated into nature with a view of the bay of the sea. A much better location for sure!

My hosts had arranged the Jeddah Old City guided tour for me with Carmel. The walking tour lasted two hours under the expert guidance of the very competent Hoda. Not only did she know the history of the old town very well, she also seemed to know everyone in the neighborhood. We were also joined by an apprentice tour guide Mohammed who is again knowledgeable. The tour included a stop in a renovated house for Saudi Arabian coffee. The tour was followed by dinner at the Al Nakheel restaurant which was some distance away. It turns out that there was a miscommunication with our driver and he wasn't waiting to transport us. Muhammad and Hoda coordinated with him to return to pick us up, and took us to a tea shop while we waited.

The dinner was preordered by the tour manager Hamza and it was excellent.

Overall it was a very enjoyable afternoon and evening.

name: Chapter jadid
address: Bab Jadid, Abu Inabah, Al-Balad, Jeddah 22236, Jeddah Saudi Arabia
text:
Jeddah appears to have been originally surrounded by coral reef barriers on the Arabian coast. In 1050, Persian poet Naser Khusrow visited Jeddah and recorded that the sturdy walls made of coral reef limestone have two gates on the sea and Mecca side, with 5,000 boys and a bustling bazaar. Apparently it's still there. At the beginning of the 16th century, Jeddah was attacked by Portuguese troops and Bewynns, so Marmuk's sultan Gauri rebuilt the fortress wall surrounding the city in 1509 to protect the city. Apparently he ordered it to do so. The walls were demolished in 1947 as the city developed, but there are seven gates in total, at Bab Makkah, Bab Al-Madina, Bab Al-Sharif, Bab Al-Bint, Bab Al-Mughrabi It appears that Bab Al-Jadeed and Bab Al-Saba were added at the beginning of the 20th century. This Bab Al-Jadeed appears to have been built for cars to pass through.
Today, the gate is located in a square with a large road passing nearby. This is the gateway to visit the old townscape and buildings of Jeddah.

name: Heritage AlEyadah Museum
address: Jubbah 55679 Saudi Arabia
text:
Clinic Heritage Museum is a facility by Clinic where you can experience the local culture. We visited by bus on a local guided tour from Japan. While waiting for lunch, we received dates, coffee, water and more in a large tent. We had a delicious lunch in a tent somewhere else, and then we visited a well where two white camels were walking around to draw water, and a garden where the water was flowing through narrow channels. There were also so many buildings and old tools that could be made from soil. The site is large and it appears that students are visiting. Right next to the site is Jubbah Rock Art Heritage, which was registered as a World Heritage Site in 2015, and it seems to be the standard way to visit together, making it a very popular facility among local Saudi Arabians.
The method of collecting water from a well is that a rope is connected to a large bag located inside the well, and as the camel moves forward, the rope is pulled and the bag containing water is lifted. It's very well done and fun to watch.
Mr. Clinic was very kind and posed under the gate for photos, and he actually moved it and showed me that the wooden pulley above the gate was moving.

description_x:
The Mosque of Badr, also known as Masjid Al-Areej, is a historic mosque located in Badr, near Medina, Saudi Arabia. It marks the site of the **Battle of Badr (624 CE)**, the first major battle in Islamic history, where Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and his companions achieved victory.  

The mosque serves as a reminder of this significant event and is a **popular stop for visitors** exploring Islamic heritage sites. While it is a relatively simple structure, its **spiritual and historical importance** makes it a meaningful place for pilgrims and history enthusiasts.

description_x: Quba Mosque in Medina Saudi Arabia is the first mosque in Islam built by Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) in 622 CE during his migration from Mecca. Mentioned in the Qur'an (Surah At-Tawbah 9:108) it is a place of piety. Praying two RakÔøΩahs here is equivalent to Umrah. The mosque has been expanded over time featuring white domes tall minarets and spacious halls making it a significant site for visitors and pilgrims.

name: Ghars Well
address: CJWG+3VG, Ali Ibn Abi Talib Qurban, Medina 42316 Saudi Arabia
text:
Arabia. It is considered one of the most important historical sites in the city and is revered by Muslims as a significant place in the early history of Islam.

The well is said to have been dug by the companions of the Prophet Muhammad and is believed to have provided them with water during their stay in Medina. According to Islamic tradition, it was at this well that the Prophet Muhammad and his followers took refuge during their migration from Mecca to Medina.

Aside from its historical significance, Ghar'a Well is also significant due to its architectural style and design. The well is made up of a series of interconnected underground chambers, which were designed to store water and protect it from the elements. The walls of the chambers are made of dressed stone and the well has a distinctive, domed roof that is made of brick.

Visitors to Ghar'a Well can still see the remains of the well and its surrounding structures, which have been partially restored in recent years. The site is open to visitors and is a popular destination for tourists and religious pilgrims alike.

In conclusion, Ghar'a Well is a unique and important historical site in Medina, Saudi Arabia, that has great significance for both its historical and architectural value. Its status as a place of refuge for the Prophet Muhammad and his followers during their migration makes it a revered and sacred site for Muslims, and its distinctive design and architecture make it a fascinating place to visit for visitors of all backgrounds.

name: Grave Of Hamzah
address: Sayed As Shuhada, Medina Saudi Arabia
text:
There is an enclosure at the foot of Mount Uhud near Madinah, where the Martyrs of Battle of Uhud fought between the Muslims and the Meccans are buried. Amongst them in a corner is the grave of Hazrath Amir Hamza ( May Allah be pleased with him ) who is the Uncle of Prophet ( Peace be upon him) and he fought bravely in this battle. Prophet loved him very much and cannot easily forget his loss. Many other Martyrs who lost their precious lives in this battle are also buried here. Pilgrims to Madinah don‚Äôt forget to visit this place along with Mount Uhud & it is a part of the itinerary of the local tour operators. Nobody is allowed inside the enclosure which has a grill gate, but it is visible from outside. Best time is to visit either in the morning or in the evening, otherwise it is very hot& humid. There are lot of shops opposite to it selling various items like dates, honey, medicinal herbs, clothings etc. 
        Prophet during his lifetime used to visit the graves of Martyrs of Uhud and hence it is sunnah (good practice) to follow & visit the same. But care should be taken not to indulge in un-Islamic practice or Biddat such as performing Tawaaf, tying threads, throwing money etc. Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to rekindle your faith.

name: The House Of Syeda Fatima Bint Al-Husayn
address: Al Usayfirin, Medina 42315 Saudi Arabia
text: When visiting Makkah and Madinah, our purpose extends beyond performing Umrah and offering prayers at the Prophet Muhammad's (PBUH) mosque. We are drawn to these sacred cities by a desire to explore their rich religious, historical, and cultural significance, steeped in the spiritual aura of Islam. During our recent visit to Madinah, we had the privilege of visiting the house of Syeda Fatimah bint Husayn, a place deeply entrenched in history. She built this house and a well inside it when she moved from her grandmother Fatima's (RA) house. This move was necessitated when Fatima's house became part of the expanding Prophet's Mosque. Syeda Fatimah remained in Madinah while her father participated in the battle of Karbala, where he ultimately met his martyrdom in 110 AH. Fatima was also present in Karbala and was later taken as a captive to Kufa and then to Damascus, along with other members of Imam Hussain's family. Despite the hardships she endured, Fatima played a crucial role as a narrator of the tragic events of Karbala and its aftermath. It is said that Syeda Fatimah's resemblance to her grandmother, Fatima (RA), the daughter of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), was striking, adding a poignant layer to her story. Her life and experiences are a testament to the resilience and strength of faith that characterize the descendants of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

text:
Al -Ghamamah Mosque is a historical landmark that attracts the visitors of Medina. The visitors of Medina are keen to visit the Al -Ghamamah Mosque and pray in it, as it was the last of the places in which the Messenger, may God‚Äôs prayers and peace be upon him, prayed the Eid prayer and called ‚ÄúAl -Ghamamah‚Äù when it is said that the cloud of the sun was withheld from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace When his prayers, as he prayed in the absent prayer on Al -Najashi
It is only 500 meters from the Prophet‚Äôs Mosque, from the southwestern side of the Prophet‚Äôs Mosque, and it contains an ancient civilized heritage, landmarks and memory associated with the biography of the Prophet and the sons of the mosque in the state of Omar bin Abdul Aziz, may God be pleased with him
Especially since it still maintains its ancient architectural style, which reflects the volume of care and care in Islamic mosques throughout history.
The mosque was covered from the outside with black basalt stones, and its domes, its inner walls and the cavities of the domes were painted with the light (white), and the shoulders and contracts remained in black, which gave the mosque a beautiful view in the consistency of the two colors.

name: King Fahd Glorious Quran Printing Complex
address: Tabuk Trunk Road, Medina Saudi Arabia
text: This is a wonderful printing press exclusively for printing the Holy Quran not only in Arabic but also with translation in various languages. They are for free distribution not only to pilgrims visiting Mecca & Madinah but also all over the world. The whole press is mechanised and job done with much precision, as it is a Holy Book and cannot be touched without wuzu (Ablution). Admission is restricted and with prior permission. One can view the job done from above only. Many types of Qurans are also on display in glass cases. Even a copy is gifted to visitors. Worth a visit and carry its memories and share with others.

name: Al-Masjid Al-Nabawi
address: King Abdul Aziz Rd Central Madina, Medina 42311 Saudi Arabia
text:
Al-Masjid an-Nabawƒ´ is a mosque established and originally built by the Islamic prophet Muhammad, situated in the city of Medina in Saudi Arabia.
Masjid Nabawi has always mesmerized me with its immense charm.Masjid Nabawi¬†was the second mosque built in the¬†history of Islam¬†. It¬†is the second-holiest site in Islam, after¬†al-Masjid al-Haram¬†in Mecca. 
.The Prophet (peace be upon him) himself participated in the construction of this mosque, called it "My Mosque" and led prayers in it for years. He has also said that a¬†salah¬†performed in the Prophet‚Äôs Mosque is better than a thousand¬†salats¬†in any other place except Masjid al-Haram in Makkah.
description_x: Masjid Nabawi is one of the most important landmarks in the history of Islam. Visiting this larger than life landmark is a dream for the Muslims around the world.

name: Jannatul Bahqi
address: Southeast of the Masjid al-Nabawi, Medina Saudi Arabia
text: It is the most blessed graveyard of the Muslims in the world. Its importance and sacrosanctness lies in the fact that, Prophet‚Äôs (Peace be upon him) wives, daughters, son Ibrahim, and inneumerable companions are buried her. It faces his Tomb opposite the entrance named Baqi, of the Grand Mosque of Madinah. It is a vast area with concretely laid pathways. There are no markings or structures on the graves of such a large number of blessed souls, unlike other Muslim graves in the world. Moreover, entry to this place is also restricted to males only and in the appointed hours in the morning & evening only, and not at all times of the day. Every Muslim in the world longs to be buried here to attain salvation. Every Pilgrim to Mecca for Haj&Umra visits Madinah and every visitor to Madinah makes it a point to visit this place. A large number of birds mostly pigeons can be seen here and visitors feed them also. A visit to this place will definitely give peace & contentment to the soul.

It is said that Muhammad's army was 3,000 and the other side was 10,000. Muhammad prayed for victory at Mount Serra and brought the body of his army to Mount Sara. Muhammad was to win this battle.

name: Historical Places of Medina
address: Haram, Medina Saudi Arabia
text:
During my job in Saudi Arabia from 1974 to 1996, and during my subsequent visits, I had the chance to explore numerous historical, religious, and ancient landmarks. TripAdvisor published my 63 reviews, and I've selected 10 noteworthy attractions:
1.	Hejaz Railway Station: Opened in 1908 and closed in 1920, the Ottoman Empire built this railway and ran from Damascus to Medina. It fell into disrepair after the Arab Revolt of 1917.
2.	Battle of Badr Memorial: This memorial lists the names of the companions of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) who were martyred in the first battle for Islam.
3.	Masjid al-Fas‚Äôah: The demolished remains at the foot of Mount Uhud mark where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) offered Dhuhr prayer during the Battle of Uhud.
4.	Masjid al-Fatah: This mosque marks the site where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) supplicated during the Battle of Khandaq and received glad tidings of victory from Allah.
5.	Masjid al-Ghamama: Located 300 meters southwest of Masjid-e-Nabawi, this mosque was built where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) performed Eid salah in his later years.
6.	Masjid Jumah: This mosque marks the spot where Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) led the first-ever Jummah prayer with about 100 companions.
7.	Masjid al-Ra‚Äôyah: Situated on Mount Dhubab, this mosque marks the spot where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) pitched his tent while digging the trench for the Battle of Khandaq.
8.	Masjid al-Shaikhain: This mosque marks the spot where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) prayed on the eve of the Battle of Uhud and prepared for the battle.
9.	Mount Uhud: Located north of Medina, this mountain was the site of the second battle between the Muslim community of Medina and the Quraysh tribe from Makkah.
10.	Qiblah Change Pillar: This pillar, located near Bab-e-Jibraeel, marks the spot where the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) led prayer in Medina when the Qiblah was towards Masjid al-Aqsa, opposite Makkah.

name: Jabal-e-rahmat
address: Mecca 24258 Saudi Arabia
text: A historic site that is one of the places to visit in Makkah. It is a small mountain in Arafat, at the base of which the Prophet Muhammad Ô∑∫ supplicated during his farewell pilgrimage and delivered the Farewell Sermon to the Muslims who had accompanied him for the Hajj towards the end of his life. On the 9th of Dhul Hijjah, thousands of pilgrims gather around this mountain during the most important rite of Hajj. It is also known as the Mount of Mercy located at a barren plain some 20 kilometers (12 mi) east of Makkah, where the pilgrims stand in contemplative vigil. The granite hill reaches about 70 m in height. The Day is known as the day where if sought after, millions of Muslims' sins are forgiven by Allah, and He perfected the religion of Islam. Some Muslims believe that Mount Arafat is the place where Adam and Eve reunited on Earth after falling from Heaven. A pillar is erected on top of the mountain to show where this event is believed to have taken place. The Makkah Metro has been serving this location since 2010. On a typical Hajj, the walk is roughly 21 km.

name: Jabal al-Nour
address: Mecca 24238 Saudi Arabia
text:
Jabal Al -Nur Jabal Al -Nour is located in the ancient Shamel direction of the Sacred Mosque in Makkah Al -Mukarramah. Where the Prophet Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace, was worshiped in it before the mission, in which the revelation was revealed to the Messenger, peace be upon him, the first time with the message in the cave of Hira, and it is manifested in ascending to the top of this mountain, scenes of faith related to the descent of the revelation, and the servant of the Prophet Muhammad 
Jabal Al -Nur is one of the five mountains in which the Prophet Ibrahim, peace be upon him, built the honorable Kaaba. The mountain overlooks many Meccan neighborhoods, including the Jabal Al -Nour neighborhood, which derives its name from the nomination of the mountain, the washing machine neighborhood, and the valley of Jalil, which includes different houses in their length and shape. It is 4 km from the Grand Mosque.
description_x: In the Muslim religion, Muhammad received his first revelation from God on this mountain.

name: Jabal Thaur
address: Mecca Saudi Arabia
text: This is the cave that the prophet (saw) and his companion (ra) escaped to save their lives while being chased by trackers. It‚Äôs a steep mountain. Anyone with back problems of any kind or mobility concerns should not attempt this mountain. It takes 2 hours for an able bodied person to climb and up to 4 hours for anyone else. Rocks are steep and the journey is treacherous winding up the mountain. You are constantly near to cliff edges there are no barriers to stop you falling so you must have good treads on your shoes to grip. You go up and down the same way. Many people will be using the same route as you. There are small hut shops dotted along the route so you can buy water and snacks if yours run out. I highly recommend a sugar fix maybe juice or chocolate to normalise your blood pressure for when you reach the top. There is a snack hut at the top. And no there are no toilets along any of the route. When you reach the top access to the small cave is tiny. Only a few people can fit. There will be a small queue for those wanting to offer prayers inside the cave. Coming down is harder than upwards because gravity will make you go faster. Many people fall and slip on the gravel on the way down. Take it slow. Don‚Äôt try and be fast, or smart. You cannot outwit nature. I saw people with diabetes, high blood pressure, old age, mobility issues, cry tears of pain and exhaustion having come so far and have to turn back because the physical pain was just too much to bear. If you have to walk a lot the next day then this uphill climb is not for you. It will leave you exhausted, tired, and ladies will get swollen ankles and feet. Go with a positive mindset. Take it very slow. Good grip shoes or trainers. Take snacks and liquids. Set aside at least 3 to 4 hours uphill. And 2 hours downhill. When you get to the top it is worth seeing and feeling what the Beloved had to go through. A spiritual place indeed. Don‚Äôt worship it. Be considerate of it and mindful of the mercy and miracle the Almighty bestowed on his Beloved.

name: The Kiswa Factory Of The Holy Ka'aba
address: 8308 Old Makkah Jeddah Rd, Mecca 24321 Saudi Arabia
text:
The ksiwa Factory of Holy Kaaba is located about 11 km away from haram. The holy Ghilaf-e-kaabba stitched here round the year. You need to get permit before entering the premises. You have to apply for permit through their website for group of 20 people. 
Being muslim, This will be your most spiritual journey where you will see documentary for  different stages/testing during preparation of ghilaf. There is visistor gallery where you can come across different items (thread, colour, cloth, needles etc) used during preparation. The best part is, if you are lucky you can have a chance to make one stitch. 
It is located next to exihibition of two holy moaques on madina munawwrra road and can be reached by Taxi (100 riyal). 
Highly recommended to visit. Memories will go down till life.

name: Wadi Taib Al-Asm
address: Maqnah Saudi Arabia
text: A small beach, a few palm trees, a stream that flows towards the Gulf of Aqaba, surrounded by granite walls. And then a gaping opening, like a sword that would have opened the mountain. We enter a gigantic flaw that sinks into the massif. Majestic. We go from shade to light according to the meanders. This mineral universe is animated by bird songs. Here and there greenery, miracle of water. An out of time excursion.

name: Falawat Tours (Najran Tours)
address: King Fahad St, Najran 66234 Saudi Arabia
text:
‚ÄãIt was fun !‚Äã  We had 6-day-tour with ‚ÄãFalawat (Najran) tours‚Äã‚Äã

They arranged 4 SUV cars for us. 4 of us (excluding the driver) sat together in each car. You can swap the car and buddies every day.

4 drivers communicated with digital 2 way radios equipped in each car so every car would be on the same track.

Mohammed is knowledgeable and very calm.
When we came across some issues, he still stayed calm and did his best to fix them.

The accommodation they chose in Alula is amazing. ‚ÄúSh‚Äãalal‚Äã resort‚Äù 
You might not be able to find lots of information about the property but he should choose it if you book a tour with him.
I don‚Äôt think breakfast will be served if you book the resort by yourself. Mohammed and his team prepared a very nice breakfast for all of us as all meals were supposed to be included. 
The breakfast is one of the highlights of the tour.

It was a small group tour. His team looked after us very well.

During trips we can provide camps, meals, hotel rooms, museums tickets, boats and experienced tour guides for our customers.

name: Vary
address: Banban Airport streat, Riyadh Saudi Arabia
text:
Banban is historical Sie located north of Riyadh. it was once a small village rich in water and trees, situated on the edge of a alley of the same name.

Today, with the expansion of Riyadh, it has become one of its neighborhoods. 
The location is well-known and mentioned in ancient Arabic poetry, often cited as metaphor for its abundance of water, trees, and blessings  

Nearby, a large environmental park named King Salman Park has been established covering more than MM3 Sqm. 

It is suited for camping, family outings and Childers

name: Scientist's Gift Organization
address: Riyadh Saudi Arabia
text: A friend recommended this small tour to Almasmak Fortress, where I was able to visit the exterior of the fortress, the souk, Al Rajhi Mosque, and enjoy typical Saudi dishes with a diverse group. Very interesting and the staff was friendly, absolutely recommended!

name: 365 Adventures Saudi Arabia
address: Qirawaan Dist. R7178 Westbay, Riyadh 00000 Saudi Arabia
text:
I loved being out in the water with all my friends, and nothing could have ruined that but honestly the staff during our trip nearly did. I‚Äôm a fairly experienced kayaker in seas, lakes, rivers and rapids and this is the first time I have been discriminated against because of my size. (I would say I‚Äôm small-mid fat, US size 16-18) The member of staff told me and my whole group that I should use a double kayak ‚Äúbecause of my weight‚Äù but didn‚Äôt back this up with an explanation. Maybe the kayaks here are cheaper and less sea worthy than others I‚Äôve used previously. I did it anyway to save embarrassment and time because the process of getting us on the water was very slow. As it happened, the girl who shared with me was much smaller and the weight distribution was completely wrong due to this being a double kayak. I felt unsafe the whole time but luckily, as mentioned I am experienced and a very strong swimmer.  Then we had a great time all kayaking together and swimming together, but at the end another member of staff suggested we set up a photo for breast cancer awareness and told us to ‚Äúform the shape of a ribbon with our kayaks‚Äù. She had no idea how to direct this and expected us to just know how to make the shape she envisioned with no help or leadership. We tried for about 10 minutes but all ended up very frustrated and cranky because we couldn‚Äôt get this task right. Then we had an equally slow process of getting out of our kayaks as we had getting in them. 

So to sum up- you will have fun with your friends, but prepared to be fat shamed if you dare to be out in public in a swimsuit and you are over a size 16.
description_x:
An ancient land lies between the Red Sea & the Persian Gulf awaiting to unfold its stories to curious travelers. 
Saudi Arabia is an underrated Middle Eastern destination where vast deserts, towering mountains, and rich cultural heritage blend seamlessly with modernity. From the golden sands of the desert to the gleaming skyscrapers of Riyadh and Jeddah, and the cool mountains of Asir and Baha

But Abdullah is genuinely in love with this place. It truly feels like he doesn't take this as a work but rather enjoy it. He even has his "office" on the mountaintop! When he introduces this place, he was eloquent and as if it's his own territory. Meanwhile, he is extremely serious about taking pictures for guests. His standards for photos are even higher than my own! I highly  appreciate him and  will recommend him to all my friends who want to travel to Arabia. ThanksÔºÅ

name: Ko Coffee
address: JMJG+CGQÿå ÿßŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ± ÿ≥ÿ∑ÿßŸÖ ÿ®ŸÜ ÿπÿ®ÿØÿßŸÑÿπÿ≤Ÿäÿ≤ÿå ÿ≠Ÿä ÿπŸÑŸäÿ¥ÿ©, Ulaishah, Riyadh 12743, Saudi Arabia
text:
I gave 5 üåüs and here is why...the coffee is amazing!
I ordered a hot mocha, an iced vanilla drink, and an ice tea.
My family agreed that all of the drinks were very tasty and satisfying. We ordered a chocolate and blueberry muffin, and a slice of blueberry cheesecake, and 3 egg and cheese sandwiches. The muffins were warm so they tasted pretty good. The cheesecake was old and very stale BUT! In their defense they replaced it the next day with a slice that was much better. Being from the USA it was not the cheesecake taste that i was use to but someone said that cheesecake here is made differently and when you compare the two I guess that the extremely rich decadent version is not all that good for ya...whatever you need to tell yourself right?ü§£
So as I was writing above, they redeemed themselves the next day with a fresh slice so all was well.
They offered me a free coffee as well but as I mentioned above, the mocha coffee was very tasty so there was no need.
Am I the only one that did not know that here in Riyadh an egg and cheese sandwich means "a boiled egg" and cheese sandwich? Anywho...
The brother who comes outside to wait on you is very kind, pleasant. And efficient!  Yes, I did write that he comes outside, takes your order and returns pretty promptly to your car with your food.
Even though I was served in my car I gave 5 üåü because well the waiter created a very pleasant atmosphere üòä
I think that their business is going to grow once word gets around that you are served old style at the window of your car.. I worry though about the traffic, and parking space once business picks up. It is very limited and shared with other businesses ü§î
I should mention that they are a bit pricy. I spent 92SAR. Didn't really pay attention because I was paying with a cardüòï. When I returned the next day and realized that a coffee and muffin was 20SAR...let's just say that my new breakfast place won't see me as often as I thought.

text:
I had the pleasure of visiting Coffee Address on Kharis Branch Rd, and it was an enjoyable experience. The caf√© has a cozy and modern ambiance, perfect for a quiet coffee break or catching up with friends. The coffee was excellent, with a rich flavor and just the right balance of bitterness and sweetness.

The baristas were friendly and attentive, ensuring that my order was prepared exactly to my liking. I also appreciated the variety of pastries available, which paired well with my drink.

One area for improvement would be the seating arrangement, which can feel a bit cramped during busy hours. However, this is a minor issue in an otherwise pleasant caf√©. Overall, Coffee Address is a great spot for quality coffee in a relaxed setting. I‚Äôll definitely be returning!

name: Madeleine
address: The Boulevard, Prince Turki Bin Abdulaziz Al Awal Rd, Hittin, Riyadh 11564, Saudi Arabia
text:
Madeleine is a charming French restaurant renowned for its inviting atmosphere and exquisite culinary offerings. The establishment features a diverse menu that showcases delicious pancake recipes and a robust selection of specialty coffees, perfect for starting your day on a delightful note. The breakfast options cater to various dietary preferences, ensuring that everyone can find something to suit their lifestyle, whether they're watching their weight or simply seeking a wholesome meal.

The restaurant prides itself on providing a lovely environment, making it an ideal spot for gatherings and leisurely meals. In addition to breakfast, Madeleine also offers an impressive array of cakes and pastries, all freshly made and simply divine. Whether you stop by for a leisurely lunch or an elegant dinner, you can expect beautifully crafted dishes that reflect the rich flavors of French cuisine. It's a place where you can indulge your senses while enjoying a cozy and welcoming ambiance.

text:
I recently visited this place and had an incredible experience! From the moment I walked in, the ambiance was inviting and cozy, perfect for relaxing with friends. The decor was stylish, and the lighting created a warm, inviting atmosphere. Television is an added benefit.

The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to recommend flavors and help with any questions. I tried their signature sheesha flavors, and they were absolutely delightful! Each puff was smooth and flavorful, making it a truly enjoyable experience.

What impressed me the most was the variety of options available, from traditional flavors to unique blends that you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. The lounge area was spacious, with comfortable seating that made it easy to kick back and enjoy the evening.

Overall , must-visit for anyone looking for a great sheesha experience. Whether you're a seasoned enthusiast or new to sheesha, you'll find something to love here. I can't wait to return!

address: 6503 ÿßŸÜÿ≥ ÿ®ŸÜ ŸÖÿßŸÑŸÉÿå, 6503ÿå 3778, Riyadh 13524, Saudi Arabia
text:
Yesterday, I visited Home Bakery Riyadh with two friends for brunch, and it was a fantastic experience. The food was outstanding, the atmosphere was welcoming, and the service was thoughtful.

Our Orders:
1.	Turkish Simit (with added salmon) ‚Äì The flavors were well-balanced, and it suited our taste perfectly.
2.	King‚Äôs Croissant ‚Äì A massive pastry with a slight spicy kick, adding an enjoyable twist.
3.	Scrambled Egg B√∂rek ‚Äì Flaky, flavorful, and exceeded my expectations.
4.	Mushroom Croissant ‚Äì Rich, well-prepared, and delicious.
5.	Milk Cake ‚Äì Complimentary due to delayed tea; incredibly soft, creamy, and a delightful surprise.

The atmosphere was warm and inviting. Despite the place being crowded, it wasn‚Äôt overly noisy, making it a comfortable setting. We had to wait 20 minutes for a table, but it was definitely worth it. The location is also practical, with plenty of parking spaces available downstairs. Additionally, the place is kid-friendly, making it a great option for families.

Overall, Home Bakery Riyadh delivered an excellent brunch experience with high-quality food, great service, and a cozy ambiance. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a delicious and enjoyable dining experience.

text:
I have been a regular customer of Dunkin' Donuts for quite some time now and I must say, I am thoroughly impressed with their service and quality of food. The staff at this particular location are extremely friendly and always greet you with a smile. They are very quick to take your order and ensure that you get your food as soon as possible.

The donuts at this Dunkin' Donuts are absolutely delicious and always fresh. They have a wide variety of flavors and each one of them is unique and simply mouth-watering. The coffee is also exceptional and is always brewed to perfection. I particularly enjoy their iced coffee, which is a great refreshment on a hot summer day.

The staff at this Dunkin' Donuts location are also very accommodating and always willing to make adjustments to your order based on your preferences. They are very efficient in their work and always ensure that the customer is happy with their food and service.

Overall, I would highly recommend Thin Dunkin‚Äô Donuts to anyone who is looking for a great cup of coffee or a tasty donut. The staff here are simply amazing and make every visit a great experience. I would definitely give this Dunkin' Donuts location a five-star rating for their exceptional service and delicious food.

name: PUNCH COFFEE | ÿ®ŸÜÿ¥
address: 2529 Alsail Alkabeer Rd, Al Mahdiyah, Riyadh 13756, Saudi Arabia
text:
If you're looking for a quick and convenient way to get your coffee fix, look no further than Punch Coffee Drive Thru. This coffee shop offers a unique drive-thru experience that allows you to get your coffee on-the-go, without sacrificing quality or taste.

One of the things that sets Punch Coffee Drive Thru apart from other coffee shops is the quality of their coffee. Each cup is made with high-quality beans that are roasted to perfection, resulting in a rich and flavorful taste that can't be beat.

But it's not just the coffee that's great at Punch Coffee Drive Thru - the service is wonderful as well. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, always willing to offer recommendations or answer any questions you may have.

And let's not forget about the convenience factor. The drive-thru experience at Punch Coffee Drive Thru is fast and efficient, allowing you to get your coffee and be on your way in no time. It's the perfect solution for busy mornings or when you're in a rush.

But even with the drive-thru format, Punch Coffee Drive Thru still manages to create a welcoming and inviting atmosphere. The decor is modern and sleek, with comfortable seating and a cozy vibe that makes you feel right at home.

Overall, I would highly recommend Punch Coffee Drive Thru to anyone looking for a quick and convenient way to get their coffee fix. The combination of high-quality coffee, friendly service, and convenient drive-thru format make it a must-visit for anyone in the area. Five stars, without a doubt!

name: McDonald's
address: Naseem area, An Nasim Ash Sharqi, Riyadh 14243, Saudi Arabia
text:
McDonald's in Riyadh is a popular fast-food chain known for its burgers, fries, and other fast-food items. They offer a variety of menu options, including beef, chicken, and fish burgers, as well as salads, wraps, and desserts. It's a convenient spot for a quick and satisfying meal on the go.

In addition to the traditional menu items like burgers and fries, McDonald's in Riyadh also offers localized options to cater to local tastes. These may include items like the McArabia, a sandwich with grilled chicken or beef in Arabic bread with garlic sauce. They also often have special promotions and limited-time offers, so it's worth checking their menu regularly for new items and deals.

text:
I recently dined at Azzurro, the exquisite Italian restaurant located in the Ritz Carlton Hotel, Riyadh, and I can confidently say it was an unparalleled culinary experience. From the moment I walked in, the ambiance exuded elegance and warmth, setting the stage for a remarkable evening.

The service at Azzurro is nothing short of impeccable. The staff is attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about ensuring every guest has a memorable visit. Specifically Montasser, Mona, Eid, Nawaf, and Michael. They provided insightful recommendations and accommodated our preferences with grace and enthusiasm. The attention to detail and personalized service truly elevated the dining experience.

Azzurro not only offers an unforgettable dining experience but also manages to capture the essence of Italy in the heart of Riyadh. The blend of outstanding dishes, top-notch service, and a luxurious setting makes it a standout choice for anyone looking to indulge in authentic Italian cuisine.

Highly recommended!

name: SPOUT
address: Winter Wonderlandÿå Al Ghadir, Riyadh 12362, Saudi Arabia
text:
Dark themed cafes always spike a sense of thrill and excitement. Spout cafe is one to look out for. Brilliant taste, excellent service and great new ambience.

Service (9/10): Fast service, neat and tidy place. The baristas and hosts were cordial. COVID checks done at entry.

Ambience (9/10): I personally love dark themed cafes and restaurants so I am rating it highly however the internal decor is really fantastic.

Drinks (8/10): The taste was appealing and it is surely a place I would recommend for an unique experience. As it is located in the The Zone, the external setting too enhances the mood. The price is a bit on the higher side which was slightly unsettling.

Drinks Ordered :
1. Spout Latte (Cold) : A very unique blend of strong and sweet cold latte. A very special taste which I haven't had anywhere yet. It is strong as well as sweet which was really mind-blowing for me.
2. Spanish Latte (Cold): Their Spanish latte was also great in taste but nothing special in terms of uniqueness.

Budget : 45-65 SAR for two.

name: Calibrated Coffee Roasters
address: Rd, Northern Ring Br Rd, Al Muruj, Riyadh 12283, Saudi Arabia
text:
A beautiful day, Good morning, Riyadh, It is Wednesday, and I am on the road to my next destination,Calibrated Coffee Roasters. I had aligned with the owner (Mr. Mohammed), yesterday to take pictures and videos for my review.

The ambiance is beautiful, with a nice aesthetic design, comfortable seating,  white curtains, and indoor plants, adorning the Caf√©.

There is  both indoor and outdoor seating, and the views are amazing, especially King Abdullah Financial District (KAFD) buildings and some prominent hotels (Move n Pick) on the opposite side of the road.

The expert barista and roaster is Mr. Mohammed Fouad, from Yemen üáæüá™ with over 3 years experience and Mr. Sujal from Nepal üá≥üáµ is the barista with over 2 years of experience. Let's discover the coffee.

The first is a Kalita drip coffee hot, brewed by hand with Colombia üá®üá¥ NARINO coffee beans with a cup flavor profile of fruity, sweetness, apple, full texture, the sweet taste and flavor was refreshing. My rating is 10 out of 10.

The second is an espresso double shot brewed with Ethiopia GUJI SHAKISO coffee beans with a cup flavor profile of fruity, sweetness, jasmine, green apple, rich texture. It is indulgent with balanced acidity and velvety creamy body. My rating is 10 out of 10.

The last is Flat White, prepared with Brazil ROSA MORENA coffee beans with a cup flavor profile of floral, moderate sweetness, smooth acidity, and a rich body. The expertise of barista was evident (standard hot temperature doing the trick). The taste was nice and balanced. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The three desserts paired with the coffees have been ideal in complimenting the flavors of the coffee.

The Cinnamon had a well-balanced sweetness and smooth texture of the brioche, the topping of caramel, and Dulce de Leche sauce with nuts had me craving for....every bite was pure delight with Kalita drip coffee. My rating is 10 out of 10.

The crunchy bite (chocolate and toasted coconut) had a nice taste and flavor perfect with the espresso double shot coffee. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The pecan tart had a mild flavor and taste. The tarts are meant to be rich with crunch of the pecans and firm texture of the tart shell ... this one was just not there... missing the finesse . My rating is 8 out of 10.

Overall rating is 9.5 out of 10.

@Mr. Mohammed (owner), Fouad (Expert Barista & Roaster), and Sujal (Barista), thanks for hosting me today.

An unforgettable and memorable experience of my food journey in search of the best caf√©s, bakeries, and restaurants.

Fun fact:
"During coffee tasting, judges slurp it across the entirety of their mouth so they can accurately taste all the nuances in a coffee‚Äôs flavour This is done because your tongue detects sweetness, while the back of your throat is tuned for bitterness.

I had a pleasant dining experience at this restaurant. The food was delicious and fresh, with well-prepared dishes. I tried the beef hamburger sliders and a buratta salad, both of which were flavorful and satisfying.

The service was excellent, as the waitstaff were attentive and polite. The restaurant‚Äôs amenities were impressive, and I especially appreciated the convenience of the automatic salt and pepper containers.

Considering the quality of the food and service, the total cost of 130 SAR was very reasonable. Overall, this is a great spot for a casual yet enjoyable meal. I would definitely recommend it!

name: 8oz Coffee
address: Said Ibn Zayd Rd, Qurtubah, Riyadh 13245, Saudi Arabia
text:
8oz Coffee is truly one of the best places in Riyadh, not just for the great drinks, but for the outstanding customer service. We recently visited as a group and were blown away by how cooperative and accommodating the staff were. A special shoutout to Mr. Hani and the supervisor, who went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing experience. They even reserved the entire second floor for us, providing a private and comfortable space for our gathering.

To top it all off, they generously offered us a 15% discount on our bill, which was a pleasant surprise. The ambiance of the place is fantastic, with a relaxed and inviting vibe that makes you want to stay longer. The drinks were spot on, with the chocolate mousse standing out as a personal favorite‚Äîit's rich, heavy, but absolutely delicious.

8oz Coffee has definitely earned a spot as one of my go-to places in the city, not just for the quality of the drinks, but for the exceptional customer service. I will certainly be visiting many times in the future and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great caf√© experience in Riyadh.

If you want a comfortable, peaceful , and decent cafe in Riyadh. This is for you.

Surreal location in a prosperous neighborhood. Civilized. Clean. Vibrant and cozy square center. You can chill, take a walk, get food, all in one place!

The perfect spot to get some work done or grab a word with a friend.

text:
As I wake up to a beautiful Tuesday morning in Riyadh. The roads guide me to King Fahd Branch Road, Al Malqa.

I arrive at my destination at 6 AM. This is Gourmet Cafe, nestled on the corner. ithas both indoor, outdoor, and rooftop seating. A nice ambiance with comfortable chairs, friendly staff, welcoming the customers with a greeting of the day!

My beverage is Spanish Latte, smooth and flavorful (my rating: 8.5 ot of 10) paired with a plain croissant, nice fluffy, airy, and fresh (My rating: 7.5 out of 10).

The cafe has a green theme and lots of natural light. The view from the rooftop of King Fahd road is relaxing, the gentle breeze giving sum much needed freshness.

Overall rating 8 out of 10

name: Oak Leaves
address: Al Olaya, Riyadh 12212, Saudi Arabia
text:
Oak Leaves Caf√©, located on the third floor of Al Faisaliyah Mall, is a charming and cozy little spot that‚Äôs perfect for a quick treat or a relaxing coffee break.

Despite its small size, the caf√© offers a wide variety of freshly baked pastries and decadent desserts, catering to anyone with a sweet tooth.

Their menu also features a good selection of both hot and cold drinks, which pair wonderfully with their sweets.

What sets Oak Leaves Caf√© apart is its unique touch in retail. Alongside the usual caf√© fare, they sell beautifully handcrafted beaded necklaces, bracelets, envelopes, and other gift items, making it a one-stop shop for thoughtful presents. The caf√©‚Äôs d√©cor is inviting, with an autumn theme that creates a warm and welcoming atmosphere. One delightful detail is how they prepare customized gift cups with roses and personalized cards, making it a lovely spot for those seeking a special touch.

The staff is particularly commendable‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and always ready to help with a smile. Overall, everything at Oak Leaves Caf√© is not only delicious but also served with a personal, artistic touch that enhances the whole experience.

address: Alsail Alkabeer Rd, Al Mahdiyah, Riyadh 11111, Saudi Arabia
text:
Filter Coffee is a coffee shop that truly lives up to its name. Located in the heart of the city, it serves up an impressive variety of coffees that are sure to satisfy even the most discerning coffee connoisseur.

What sets Filter Coffee apart from other coffee shops is not only the quality of their coffee, but also their commitment to providing exceptional service. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, always willing to offer their expert advice on the best coffee to suit your taste buds.

One of the most impressive things about Filter Coffee is that it's open 24 hours a day. Whether you're an early bird or a night owl, you can always get your coffee fix at Filter Coffee.

As for the coffee itself, there are many different varieties to choose from. Each cup is brewed with care and precision, resulting in a rich and full-bodied flavor that will leave you wanting more. Whether you prefer your coffee strong and bold or smooth and mellow, Filter Coffee has something to offer.

Overall, I highly recommend Filter Coffee to anyone looking for a great cup of coffee in a warm and welcoming environment. With its impressive selection of coffees, friendly staff, and convenient 24-hour schedule, it's the perfect spot to satisfy your caffeine cravings any time of day or night.

name: L‚Äôeto Cafe
address: 3951-4039 Prince Muhammad Ibn Abd Al Aziz, As Sulimaniyah, Riyadh 12223, Saudi Arabia
text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at L‚Äôeto Cafe in Tahlia, Riyadh, and it was truly an amazing experience! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, who are undoubtedly the stars of the show. Their friendly demeanor set the perfect tone for my visit.

The ambiance of the cafe is delightful, making it an ideal spot for a relaxing breakfast. I was impressed by the wide variety of offerings on the menu, which made it hard to choose! I settled on the Bacon with Egg Benedict Toast and a pot of Americano. While the Americano didn‚Äôt quite meet my expectations, the Bacon and Egg Benedict absolutely stole the show. It was a perfect combination that left my soul and stomach feeling wonderfully satisfied.

To top off my meal, I couldn‚Äôt resist trying the milk cake, and it was fantastic‚Äîfinger-licking good! Every bite was a treat, and it perfectly complemented my breakfast.

Overall, my experience at L‚Äôeto Cafe was exceptional, and I will definitely be adding it to my list of favorites. I highly recommend this cafe to anyone looking for a delicious meal in a welcoming atmosphere!
