address: Al Bayan, ŸÖÿπ, ÿßŸÑÿßŸÖÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿßŸÅÿπŸä, Riyadh Saudi Arabia
text:
6 months, 2 weeks, 4 days,
and I still don‚Äôt know which month it was then
or what day it is now.
Blurred out lines
from hangovers
to coffee
Another vagabond
lost to love.

4am alone and on my way.
These are my finest moments.
I scrub my skin
to rid me from
you
and I still don‚Äôt know why I cried.
It was just something in the way you took my heart and rearranged my insides and I couldn‚Äôt recognise the emptiness you left me with when you were done. Maybe you thought my insides would fit better this way, look better this way, to you and us and all the rest.
But then you must have changed your mind
or made a wrong
because why did you
leave?

6 months, 2 weeks, 4 days,
and I still don‚Äôt know which month it was then
or what day it is now.
I replace caf√©s with crowded bars and empty roads with broken bottles
and this town is healing me slowly but still not slow or fast enough because there‚Äôs no right way to do this.
There is no right way to do this.

There is no right way to do this.
Charlotte Eriksson, Another Vagabond Lost To Love: Berlin Stories on Leaving & Arriving

Tags: bc, coffee, master-of-the-mountain, rewriting-history
Like  Likes: 329
Just the other day, I was in my neighborhood Starbucks, waiting for the post office to open. I was enjoying a chocolatey cafe mocha when it occurred to me that to drink a mocha is to gulp down the entire history of the New World. From the Spanish exportation of Aztec cacao, and the Dutch invention of the chemical process for making cocoa, on down to the capitalist empire of Hershey, PA, and the lifestyle marketing of Seattle's Starbucks, the modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top.
Sarah Vowell
Tags: chocolate, coffee, history

name: Almasaa Cafe
address: Al Urubah Rd, Al Wurud, Riyadh 11564, Saudi Arabia
text:
This cafe stands out as one of the premier destinations in the kingdom, thanks to its ideal location that provides breathtaking views of the Kingdom Tower. The outdoor seating area is a highlight, allowing guests to enjoy their meals while soaking in the stunning scenery. The ambiance is inviting and vibrant, making it a perfect spot for both relaxation and social gatherings.

Inside, the cafe boasts a spacious layout, ensuring that patrons have plenty of room to unwind without feeling cramped. The staff is attentive and friendly, contributing to a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the overall experience. Service is prompt and efficient, making every visit enjoyable.

However, there is room for improvement. Enhancing the comfort of the outdoor seating would significantly elevate the experience, allowing guests to linger longer and fully enjoy their surroundings. Overall, this cafe is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy great food, a lively atmosphere, and spectacular views.

name: Sulalat Coffee
address: 2329 Makkah Al Mukarramah Branch Road Store #2 Ground floor, Najm al Qurais Building, Riyadh 12821, Saudi Arabia
text:
It's Saturday, Good morning, Riyadh. I am so happy and excited to visit yet another new destination, I am at Sulalat,  a world of the finest specialty luxury coffees.

My colleagues at work, Nama and AJS, wanted me to do a review of Sulalat popular for premium coffees and baked treats. Let's go ... discover Sulalat.

The espresso single shot was the ultimate experience of a coffee connoisseur, heavy creamy body with oud and cacao notes prepared from Exit 13 (Sulalat blend), coffee beans from Indonesia (Java), Gautamela, and Ethiopia. My rating is a perfect 10 out of 10.

The coffee latte was  exquisite as the barista followed the recipe to the T (36 to 43 seconds to get it right!). The Exit 13 Sulalat blend is a delightful selection. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The Aeropress drip coffee uses Aljoud coffee beans from Saudi Arabia (locally grown in Southern Region -Jazan), and the method to prepare is unique and different. The last step required a  press to release all the goodness of a black coffee. My rating is 11 out of 10.

The baked treats and amazing assortment of croissants, the brownie croissant with vanilla, chocolate, and caramel filling was a flavor burst. Oh wow! Oh yum! What was that! My rating is 10 out of 10.

The plain croissant, a humble baked goodness, it is light soft, fluffy, crispy, and simply delicious paired with coffee latte ... hmmm. My rating is 9 out of 10.

Overall rating is a perfect 10 out of 10.

@Sulalat team (Ahmed, Mustafa, Neezar) and all the staff, thank you for hosting me today!

An unforgettable memorable experience in my food journey, in search of the best cafes, bakeries, and restaurants.

address: An Nasr Rd, Al Aziziyah, Riyadh 14511, Saudi Arabia
text:
Haten is officially my favourite cafe in Riyadh! I‚Äôve been looking for a place that would serve delicious chocolate crepe with ice cream for a reasonable price and Haten has it! 20 SAR for a crepe with ice cream is a great deal considering other places would charge more for the same! Their crepe was fresh and delicious however I wish they could put more chocolate on the top. Their coffee was great too! They have a lot of other aesthetic deserts and pastries which you definitely should try! The atmosphere is very calm with friendly staff and spacious seating arrangement.

The location is very far from the city centre but I would happily drive all the way to come and try more of their menu items!

text: Always one for trying something new and as we finished our wonderful evening meal we stepped in to Dose for the first time. Wonderful decorations, atmosphere and music just at the right level. One area I feel people think they can save money in a people facing business is to have less staff and make them work harder! In Dose they had plenty of staff and many more customers, so well done to the ops team for understanding the need for people interaction. We took a cold and hot version of the pistachio coffees and both were amazing. Will be back and referring our friends to try. Excellent place, people and product!

name: Some Coffee Bar
address: Al Lazekeiah, Al Muruj, Riyadh 12282, Saudi Arabia
text:
Oh! It's already Saturday, Good morning, Riyadh, "Saturday is a gentle reminder to enjoy the little things in life.‚Äù Today, I am at Some Coffee Bar bright and early at 6 AM, I have the go-ahead to take pictures and videos for my review.

The ambiance is beautiful with lots of natural light, well designed, and great seating.

There is a variety of coffee beans on display and awesome selection of cheesecakes, pastries, and croissants. Let's discover Some Coffee Bar and evaluate the delightful treats!

The barista of the day is Mr. Javed Aziz, from Kashmir, India üáÆüá≥ üòÄ üòé and today he is brewing a  couple of espresso shots, a couple of V60 drip coffees, and a Cortado.

The espresso single shot brewed with Ethiopia Sidamo coffee beans with a cup profile of walnut, peach, and choco, awesome crema, and fruity bittersweet flavor and taste, my rating is 10 out of 10.

The next surprise, is another espresso single shot, but this time it is brewed with China Honey King coffee beans with a cup profile of honey, raspberry, and grape, awesome crema, nice fruity sweet flavor and taste, my rating is 10 out of 10.

The Cortado is a single espresso shot made with Colombia Santa Rosa coffee beans with a cup profile of fruity pomegranate sweetness and an equal portion of latte. My first impression is that it had a bit more latte diluting the boldness of the espresso. My rating is 8 out of 10.

The V60 brewed by the machine with Ethiopia Sidamo coffee beans had a fruity bittersweet flavor profile, and my rating is 9 out of 10.

The next cup of drip coffee V60 hot, brewed by the machine with Rwanda Gesheke coffee beans, had nuts, peach, fruity cup.profie, bittersweet taste, and flavor.  My rating is 9 out of 10.

Now for the sweet treats, the Raspberry Danish pastry with nice crispy layered puff pastry with delicious pistachio custard and topped with fresh raspberries, an outright best seller. My rating is 11 out of 10.

The Belgian chocolate cookie was delicate, soft, and tasty, a bit too greasy for my palate and hands (too oily). My rating is 7 out of 10.

Overall rating is 9 out of 10.

@Mr. Javed Aziz and Mr. Md Motaleb Hosen, and the entire team at Some Coffee Bar. Thanks for hosting me today.

Another unforgettable and memorable experience of my food journey in search of the best cafes, bakeries, and restaurants.

text:
It's 5:50 AM, on a wonderful Monday morning, and I am pondering on my bucket list of cafes. Well, I have picked  ERA.

It's a slender long corridor with enough seating to get through the first half of the day.

The baristas Rifat Hossain üáßüá© and Damodar Bhurtel üá≥üáµ are brewing a coffee latte made from their in-hose blend coffee beans (Ethiopia and Columbia). My rating is 7 out of 10.

Now for the dessert, oh boy! The "Layered Cake" with their special Belgian chocolate sauce was an  exhilarating experience, simply divin, texture, flavor, and taste dancing on my palate üòã. My rating is 10 out of 10.

Overall rating is 8.5 out of 10.

@Rifat & Damondar - Thanks for hosting me.

name: Dunkin' - ÿØÿßŸÜŸÉŸÜ
address: Al Imam Saud Ibn Abdul Aziz Branch Rd, Al Izdihar, Riyadh 12486, Saudi Arabia
text:
Dunkin' Al-Izdihar is a must-visit spot for donut lovers and coffee enthusiasts. They offer some of the finest donuts in the world, with a perfect balance of flavor and texture that never disappoints. Whether you prefer classic options or creative new flavors, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

Their hot chocolate, lattes, and mochas are equally impressive, providing rich, satisfying drinks that are perfect for any time of day. Each sip is a delight, and the quality of the beverages is consistently excellent.

The service at this location is outstanding, with a team that is both polite and efficient. They add a personal touch with their friendly and funny attitude, making each visit enjoyable and memorable.

Overall, Dunkin' Al-Izdihar combines delicious food and beverages with great service, creating an experience that keeps you coming back. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in top-notch donuts and drinks!

name: The Coffee Address
address: Najd, Dhahrat Laban, Riyadh 13781, Saudi Arabia
text:
Coffee Address is a hidden gem for coffee enthusiasts. Their beans are meticulously sourced and expertly roasted, resulting in a cup of coffee that's rich in flavor and aroma. The ambiance is cozy, perfect for enjoying your favorite brew while catching up with friends or diving into a good book. Whether you prefer a classic espresso or a creamy latte, Coffee Address delivers quality and satisfaction with every sip.
Coffee Address not only excels in brewing exceptional coffee but also delights customers with their delectable cookies and desserts. Each treat is crafted with care, boasting fresh, high-quality ingredients and a perfect balance of flavors. name: Kicksters Coffee
address: Hajar Valley, Al Malqa, Riyadh 13524, Saudi Arabia
text:
It's Thursday, yet another gorgeous, beautiful day on the road to my next destination.

Good morning, Riyadh. I stopped by at Tamimi supermarket to buy fruits, and then, as I was browsing through a list of cafes, I clicked on Kicksters, and here I am, sharp at 6:10 AM.

I greet Saeed (a seasoned barista) and get permission to take pictures and videos for my review.

I am scanning the cafe and wondering how I can showcase the interiors. Wall painting, plants through pictures. Let's see ... the  ambiance is  simple, nice seating, and welcoming....

There are an impressive variety of coffee beans on display, and today, the Ethiopian, West Arsi, Erlium (the crop is grown at 2100 - 1945 altitude, the cupping notes are fruity, chocolate, black grape) this coffee variety is used to prepare a hot cup of V60 coffee (machine made), Saeed did the processing from start to finish üòã, well done! my rating is 9 out of 10.

My dessert for today is a brownie, crunchy chocolate, and rocky road. It was a delightful selection, and the sweet treats complimented well with the V60 coffee. My rating is 9 out of 10.

Overall rating is 9 out of 10.

@Saeed and team (Asadul, Samir, and Eman), thanks for hosting me today.

text:
CocoVia Caf√© inside Panorama Mall is more than just a cafe; it‚Äôs a visual and culinary experience that captivates from the moment you step in. The unique looks of the cafe set it apart, creating an ambiance that‚Äôs both inviting and distinctive. From the carefully curated decor to the thoughtfully designed menu, every aspect reflects a commitment to providing a memorable experience.

The products at CocoVia Caf√© are nothing short of exceptional. Each sip and bite tell a story of quality and craftsmanship. The diverse menu caters to a range of preferences, ensuring there‚Äôs something for every palate. On a personal note, I once had the pleasure of bringing home a whole cake from CocoVia, and it was nothing short of a masterpiece‚Äîa testament to the skill and dedication put into their products.

CocoVia Caf√© doesn‚Äôt just serve coffee and snacks; it crafts moments. Whether you‚Äôre there for a casual cup of coffee or a more indulgent experience with their delightful cakes, CocoVia knows how to elevate the ordinary into something extraordinary.

For those who appreciate a cafe that goes beyond the conventional, CocoVia inside Panorama Mall is a destination that invites you to savor not just the flavors but the artistry and uniqueness that make every visit special.

text:
Moosh is my new favorite drive-thru cafe! ‚òïÔ∏èüöò
Despite not having a dine-in option, it offers a fantastic experience.ü§©ü§©

The star of the show is definitely Keshav, the friendly barista.

The menu is varied and the prices are very reasonable, ranging from 3 to 22 SARüíµ.

Whether you want a classic coffee or something more indulgent, Moosh has it. I tried the flat white, and it was amazing perfectly balanced and creamy.

Additionally, Moosh offers a points system. They ask for your phone number at each visit to add points, which can be redeemed for rewards later on. It's a great way to get even more value out of your visits.

Overall, Moosh combines convenience, quality, and exceptional service. If you're in the area, it's a must-visit especially if Keshav is there to serve you!

text:
‚ÄúFor Coffee and Conversation‚Äù

As it says on one of the walls of this beautiful cafe. Thank you for inviting me and letting me try some of your stuff. The people there were friendly and very welcoming! Having great service definitely adds to the overall experience. And my experience here was great.

The cafe follows a clean and minimal aesthetic with super comfortable seats that are well spaced out with the serving area right in the middle of the cafe. We were given both the signature drinks, The Hot and Iced Central Latte, Cheese turkey sandwich, Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich, Iced Spanish Latte, Hot Chocolate, Two Coffee of the days which were essentially Black Coffees but one of them with milk, and a Blueberry Cheesecake. I really liked the Iced Central Latte, it‚Äôs good and it can cover a wide range of customers preferences, not the best for those who love a strong coffee taste in their drink, for that sort of preference I‚Äôd definitely recommend the Coffee of the day and the Hot Central Latte. They were strong in taste and Rich in Raw Coffee flavour. They‚Äôre not for me but if you like that type of coffee I definitely recommend you try it. The Hot Chocolate was lovely, and so was the Blueberry Cheesecake. And the sandwiches were great too, The Chicken Teriyaki‚Äôs bread felt a bit dry but other then that it was good. The Spanish Latte was good, not the best by any means, but not bad either.

name: CORE COFFEE & ROASTERY
address: thumama street, An Narjis, Riyadh 13323, Saudi Arabia
text:
It is Thursday, a beautiful day, great weather, nice and sunny, perfect for a good brew of delicious coffee and dessert ... hmmm ... so tempting!

Good morning, Riyadh. My next destination is recommended by my colleague at wor, Mr. Dmitry Trubkin, I have seen this cafe and roastery many times on my way to work. Well, the day has come sooner than expected.

I am super excited to review Core Coffee & Roastery (by dr. Cafe Coffee) located inside Jarir Bookstore building on Thumamah road.

I met the two expert baristas, Mr. Qasim and Mr. Abdulrahman and I have the go-ahead to take pictures and videos for my review.

The espresso single shot is brewed from the signature blend (coffee beans from Central America), tasting notes tropical fruits, dark chocolate, and hazelnut. The flavor and taste were smooth, creamy, and medium-roast. My rating is a perfect 10 out of 10.

The flat white was also made from the signature blend with a single espresso shot, and the steamed latte had a nice refreshing taste. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The drip coffee V60 hot was brewed with Ethiopia Guji coffee beans with tasting notes of papaya, dried apricots, and apple. It's the best coffee, especially when paired with a premium assortment of fine chocolates. My rating is 10 out of 10.

The dessert of the day was the creamy classic cake, while the nixed berries and red currant toppings and the graham crackers base were nice and tasty the cheese/cake wasn't so smooth and moist (a tad dry for my palate). My rating is 8 out of 10.

The assorted fine chocolates (crepe dulcey, almond praline with rice crispy, mini chocolate monarch, pecan caramel chocolate, mini chocolate salted caramel) was so yummylicious! My rating is 10 out of 10.

Overall rating is 9 out of 10.

@Mr. Qasim and Mr. Abdulrahman, thanks for hosting me today.

name: Elixir Bunn Coffee Roasters
address: 7157 Salem Bin Maaqil Al Nakheel Dist 4133, Riyadh 12392, Saudi Arabia
text:
It's Saturday, Yay! A beautiful morning, as the city wakes up, I am on the road looking for my next destination.

Good morning, Riyadh, It is 6:35 AM, i am at Elixir Bunn, and after chatting with Mr. Zuhair, I have the go-ahead to take pictures and videos for the review.

Just a quick background story on the Caf√© as per their official website:
"Our story began with the search for the best way to compose distinct flavors from Latin, African, and other sources of coffee across the world, with 10,000 taste buds in every sip. We believe that drinking coffee is one of the source of happiness and energy for millions of coffee tasters in Saudi Arabia. And for our interest in continuing and enhancing this experience from the pioneers of the coffee elixir, we sought to import the finest types of coffee in the world."

Wow! The Caf√© has beautiful interiors and very spacious and well arranged seating. There is another spacious  room with a nice center table that can seat 8 people. The Caf√© has a cool chic ambiance. Once the record player is fixed, there are over a hundred records to choose your favorite songs.

Now, for some real action with Yazeed Alhumaidi, the expert barista with over 4 plus years of experience.

I get a freshly brewed hot cup of coffee. Elixir Bunn branded Kitropiki coffee beans from Uganda üá∫üá¨ Yazeed is using Kalita equipment to make the drip coffee.

Coffee Equipment background:
"Kalita is¬†a family-owned Japanese company, first established at Nihonbashi, Tokyo in 1958. The company has been making coffee equipment for a few decades now, turning into one of the most prolific companies in the coffee products business sector."

Kitropiki is a single origin coffee from the Rwenzori Mountains, Kasese District, Western Uganda, grown at 1900 meters above sea level. Taste: berries, tea hint, tropical fruits.

My rating is 11 out of 10.

Yazeed recommends Tiramisu dessert to compliment this exquisite coffee. The Tiramisu is made in-house at Elixir Bunn and has a very nice texture and the right amount of sweetness, chocolate, and coffee. This is a seriously delicious rating, is 8 out of 10.

As per Mr. Edward Yung (customer), he rates Elixir Bunn with a solid 8 out of 10.

My overall rating is 9.5 out of 10.

@Zuhair and Yazeed, thanks for hosting me today.

Another unforgettable and memorable chapter in my food journey....

name: Wee
address: ÿ≥ÿßŸÑŸÖ ÿ®ŸÜ ŸÖÿπŸÇŸÑÿå, An Nakheel, Riyadh 12393, Saudi Arabia
text:
Good morning, Riyadh, It's 6 AM on Saturday, 28th December, 2024. I am here at WEE Caf√© and I have the go-ahead to do the review. The ambiance is elegant, modern, and has lots of natural light

The barista of the day is Mr. Muhammad Yunus Khan from Nepal üá≥üáµ with 2 years of experience.

The hot V60 drip coffee brewed by hand with Ethiopia üá™üáπ URAGA GUJI coffee beans ü´ò with notes medium body, sugarcane, fruity, the aroma is nice and sweet flavor and taste üòã my rating is 10 out of 10.

The espresso from Sulalat blend coffee beans has a nice classic taste, and the crema has a smooth texture. My rating is 10 out of 10.

The flat white prepared with Sulalat blend coffee beans ü´ò is smooth and creamy, and the flavor of espresso with latte is well-balanced. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The desserts are baked by the baker, Mr. Qasim from Yemen üáæüá™ with over 5 years experience as a baker üòÄ

The danish blueberry is delightful, the texture is crispy fresh, the icing sugar  and blueberries compote has a wonderful light taste. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The mixed berries danish is delectable and sumptuous, with the fresh berries topping with icing sugar being well executed. My rating is 9 out of 10.

The winner of the day is the chocolate cake with caramel.ice cream served in a beautiful biscuit shell, delicious combination, and crunchy texture of the biscuit shell, the softness of the cake and sweetness from the caramel ice cream was a oh wow! oh yum! What was that moment. My rating is 11 out of 10.

Overall rating is  10 out of 10.

@Mr. Yunus, Mr. Noruddin (from Bangladesh üáßüá©), thanks for hosting me today.

An unforgettable and memorable experience of my food journey in search of the best caf√©s, bakeries, and restaurants.

Quote of the day:
"Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference."¬†‚Äî¬†Winston Churchill

name: TourDragon - Saudi Arabia Tours
address: Business Gate Qurtubah Area, Riyadh 11551, AlUla 11551 Saudi Arabia
text:
Exquisite tour of ancient Arabia using reservations with Experience Al Ula.
Our Landover tour started at Hegira visiting Hinat bint Wahab reconstruction in purpose minor museum at the south gate welcome center. It is magnificent and intriguing to see the human reconstruction of Hinat, the first ever of a Nabatean resident. The entire reconstruction process is shared along with tomb # 117 where her skeleton was discovered. 
Thereafter, we visited the unfinished tomb of Lihyan son Kuza, often referred to as Madain Saleh. From there to Jebal AlAhmar (Red Mountain) where tomb # 117 is located. 
This was followed by Jebel Ithlib and the Diwan, which is superb, somewhat like a movie set with picturesque mountains that are incredible. Simply beautiful. 
Jebal Banat (Mountain of the Women) that is extraordinary, with permission to enter tomb # 26 to witness how the ancient Nabatean were buried. I was silent for much of the trip as one becomes speechless at the breathtaking views.

The next day was Jebal Khuraibah to see the tombs and excavations of Dadan & Lihyan civilizations that occured before the Nabatean. The lion tombs were resplendent and towering. Then we went across to Jebal Ikmah to view the petroglyphs that is the anciet rock art in the ancient Aramaic language that was before Arabic. It's referred to as the open air library. Our visit to AlUla Old Town was magnificent especially the view from the top of the castle. In summary, these sites are never enough viewing it only once, and therefore repeated visits are enriching and expansive to knowledge of how the Nabatean lived on the ancient Incense Road. It's no wonder that it is a recognized UNESCO World Heritage site.

I found a city that generates a very large cultural shock for those who grew up in the framework of westernized cultures. I have traveled several countries, some of them from Muslim culture and were always receptive and open for international tourism. 
I did not have that same feeling in this city. 
I traveled for work, but my family accompanied me and in the few spare time I had I could not enjoy my time with my son free, because for example I did not allow me to use the pool next to him and my husband, but they invited me To retire to use the exclusive pool for women.
On the other hand, Arab food is very rich and flavor, so I enjoyed its delicacies. They are also very service, so to all the work events I attended I was received with coffee and dates. So from the work/professional the experience was more pleasant.

text:
I had the pleasure of visiting Riyadh Golf Club during my trip to Riyadh, and I must say it exceeded all my expectations. This hidden gem for golf enthusiasts offers an exceptional experience that is worth every moment.

The first thing that caught my attention was the breathtaking scenery surrounding the course. The well-maintained fairways, adorned with palm trees and vibrant flowers, created a picturesque backdrop that made each swing feel like a dream. The course layout was intelligently designed, offering a perfect balance of challenging holes and enjoyable gameplay for golfers of all skill levels.

Upon arrival, I was warmly welcomed by the friendly and attentive staff at the elegant clubhouse. The facilities were top-notch, providing a comfortable environment for golfers and visitors alike. The pro shop was well-stocked with a wide range of golfing equipment and apparel, ensuring that every golfer's needs.

name: Wadi Hanifa
address: Riyadh Saudi Arabia
text:
The journey to the Edge of the World made us down in the dumps because it turned out to be a failed mission (‚ÄúA Series of Unfortunate Events‚Äù). So as we were heading back to the capital city, we were discussing the discomforts of what took place in that valley and the plight‚Äôs silver lining. This was when the place called ‚ÄúDiriyah‚Äù surfaced. Thank heavens, all of us, especially Chauffer Sai, were still up for a rebound.

In my homeland, we usually head up to the high lands for a breath of fresh air but not here in Riyadh. Heading down to the low-lying areas like this Wadi Hanifah coulee is the theme.

Yes, we did not make it to the Edge of the World but setting foot on this historical site is also an experience of a lifetime. For a lover of history, it is always an opportunity to get a feel of an old place‚Äôs historical thread because it provides an understanding of how the place and its landscape have developed over time. How saddening it would be if we only get to learn by books more so if this were the only way to see them.

Wadi Hanifah is a great rebound and a hideaway for the city dwellers of Riyadh..

name: Riyadh Tours
address: Olya St, Riyadh 33511 Saudi Arabia
text: I had to cancel my planned trip to Hong Kong due to the Coronavirus, leaving me with 2 weeks and the need for a Plan B. Saudi Arabia Tours helped me put together an itinerary that met my interests and enabled me to experience the country. I spent a few days in Riyadh, including a fantastic trip to the Edge of the World. Then i flew across the country to Jeddah and drove to Taif and Abha. The guides drove safely and were very accommodating ‚Äî when we were unable to visit sites on the agenda due to closures, we worked together to come up with alternatives. We also stopped at random places on the road, like a camel milk market and a honey farm. Tourism in Saudi Arabia is in its infancy, so flexibility and an adventurous spirit are necessary. I was satisfied with my choice of 3-star hotels, which were pretty good for that part of the world and had decent breakfast buffets. I would encourage travelers to do their own research and visit places of interest that might not be on the set itineraries. Also, a highlight for me was meeting the extremely welcoming Saudi people, which i did on my own in the evenings. On the whole, i was happy with the services of Saudi Arabia Tours and had a wonderful time on my trip.

text:
I recently went to Thaghr Plaza and had a great time there. They have a bunch of popular cafes like Caribou, Dunkin, and Starbucks, which is awesome if you love coffee. They also have big stores like Saco, Jarir Bookstore, and Panda hypermarket for all your shopping needs.

My favorite part was finding a Chuck E Cheese's branch in the plaza. It's the best one in the city because it's not too crowded, so you can have a fun time without feeling overwhelmed. There aren't too many restaurants, but you still have a few options to choose from.

One thing I really liked about Thaghr Plaza is that it's not too busy, so it's nice and peaceful. They also have a big parking lot, which makes it easy to find a spot for your car.

I definitely recommend going to Thaghr Plaza, especially if you want to have a good time with your family.

name: Al-Dwaihra Mosque
address: Al Imam Abdulaziz Ibn Mohammad Ibn Saud, Al Bujairi, Ad Diriyah, Diryah 13711 Saudi Arabia
text:
We visited from Japan on a local guided tour. The Al Dwaihra Mosque is located in the Al Bujairi district of Ad Diriyah, known as the "Pearl of Saudi Arabia". It is located about 20km northwest of the centre of Riad. A narrow river flows through the valley called Wadi Hanifah, and on the other side is the Al Turaif district, a world heritage site with Salwa Palace, the first capital of the Saud dynasty.
The riverbank is planted with many date palms and is green, making it a park where you can have a picnic. The nearby sun-dried mud brick building has been beautifully restored, and the ground is covered with stone tiles, making it completely dusty. The mosque is a narrow alley.

When we visited, it was quiet and it was a weekday and there was no one there. In Saudi Arabia, event periods are set for each tourist destination, and Diriyah Season is from November to December (last time 22 Nov 2019 - 21 Dec 2019), so you can see ruins and facilities that are not normally open to the public. This is the best time to visit this area as you can. We visited near the end of Al Ula's Winter at Tantora Season 2 (19 Dec 2019 - 7 Mar 2020), so it was not an event time in Diriyah, and the surrounding area was blocked due to the preparations for the classic car event. There are also.
There are no easy-to-understand signs in the park or at the entrance to the mosque, so if you don't understand Arabic, it would be difficult to visit Al Dwaihra Mosque without a guide. The staff member let me in and we toured the room through the glass.

Sunni religious scholar Muhammad ibn Abd al-Wahhab was welcomed by Ibn Saud of Diliah in 1744 and spread his teachings. It is unknown when the Al Dwaihra Mosque was built, but it is quite old. The architectural styles of 10 historical mosques in Saudi Arabia are explained in the Najdi Style and the Abdullatif Al Fozan Award "Historical Mosques in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia: Investigating Architectural Styles Typology." Of the 10, we also visited Mimar Mosque, Umar Ibn Al Khattab Mosque and Shafe'i Mosques on this trip, and we were pleased to see some of the most representative mosques in a short period of time. Furthermore, the Abdullatif Al Fozan Award website includes Mosqpedia, which covers mosque architecture information, and if you search for "Dwaihra", you can see photos and drawings, making it a very valuable site for architecture lovers.

Also, while looking for photos before the mosque's restoration, information about Al Bujairi is known as "Al-Bujairi...Heart of the Call" in Publications on the Royal Commission for Riyadh City (RCRC) website. There is a 134-page publication covering the book, featuring photos of the mosque taken in the 1960s by Egyptian architect Hassan Fathy, along with photos after the restoration. There are also photos that allow you to see the bricks and the ceiling after the restoration, and illustrations inspired by the time. The mosque name is listed as "Al Dhuwayhirah mosque". The RCRC website has a very comprehensive resource on Riyadh, and there are still few publications on Saudi Arabia, so it is very helpful. By the way, there are Arabic and English versions.

Until I saw the photos before the restoration of the mosque, I thought that the restoration of the Saudi Arabian ruins would be too clean and not seem to have been aged, but since the construction method is a simple method based on sun-dried mud bricks, the area has deteriorated. I was able to understand that once I fixed it and repaired it to a passable state, the only way to fix it in such a way is to fix it neatly. To prevent such misunderstandings, it is easy to understand if you post photos of the site before the repair is displayed.

name: Dirab Golf and Country Club
address: Riyadh 11411 Saudi Arabia
text:
Dirab has been around even before golf became a mainstream sport in the Middle East.  It is a well-kept full grass course with a combination of easy, challenging and scenic holes.  It's location in the Dirab provides it with the natural land topography to have a holes with a wide degree of difficulty.  The greens are among the best among the courses I played in the region.  

The course caters to all levels of skills and has a friendly/collegial atmosphere (nobody is rushed unless, of course, a player is atrociously slow).  The staff are friendly and accommodating.  Carts are new electric and new.  

I recommend golfers visiting Riyadh on business to take the time to play in Dirab.  It's about 45 minutes from the city center depending how fast one drives.

text: The first mosques of Shaqra were established in the old days and perhaps in the first century AH (622 ‚Äì 719 CE), where Najd entered Islam in the ninth year of the Hijra. It went through various stages of construction and expansion, the last of which was in the year 1929, then it was demolished in 1964 and built with reinforced concrete, then demolished in 2003, then it was restored and rehabilitated in accordance with its old pattern in 2015 with the initiative and support of the Al-Husaynfamily and the supervision of the Heritage and Crafts Committee.

name: The Outer Wall Of Shaqra
address: Ahmed Bin Tolon Street, Shaqra Old Town, Shaqra 15518 Saudi Arabia

The outer walls of Shaqra city, one of the most prominent landmarks of the
old city, surrounded it by all sides, its circumference reaches nearly 5 km and
it contains more than 45 military compartments, some of which were
destroyed and parts of it remained, and some were restored in 1430 AH at the
expense of M. Abdul Rahman bin Abdullah Al Bawardi, under the supervision
of the Heritage and Crafts Committee.

name: Ravi Pakistani hotel Shahi Restaurant Aljada
address: Sharaa aam, Al'awayshah, Tabuk 47911, Saudi Arabia
text:
*3/5 stars*

I recently visited this hotel and had a mixed experience. The atmosphere and ambience were pleasant and welcoming, and the service was good. However, the rates were quite high, which I felt was not entirely justified by the quality of food.

I ordered the chicken jalfrezi and shahi daal, both of which were unfortunately very average in taste. The dishes lacked a wow factor and were quite normal, which was disappointing considering the high prices.

Overall, while the hotel's atmosphere and service were good, the high rates and average food quality left me feeling slightly underwhelmed. Perhaps with a few improvements in the culinary department, this hotel could live up to its full potential.

*Pros:*

- Good atmosphere and ambience
- Friendly and efficient service
- Clean and comfortable surroundings

*Cons:*

- High rates
- Average food quality
- Limited value for money

*Recommendation:*

This hotel has potential, but needs to work on its food quality and pricing strategy to justify the high rates. If you're looking for a comfortable stay and don't mind average food, this might be a decent option. However, if you're a foodie or on a budget, you might want to explore other options.

text:
I came from Riyadh for tourism as well. I like to practice my daily hobby, which is walking after the dawn prayer
The park is beautiful, but uncomfortable, not safe for children, and not clean.

The sidewalk is too small for walking.
Water sprinklers fill the sidewalk with water, and they may also get wet due to their proximity to the sidewalk while walking.
The chairs are poorly located and take up a lot of space on the sidewalk designated for walking.
The location of the castings is very, very, very bad.
The sidewalk has a landing.
The palm tree takes up part of the sidewalk.
The place is full of dead cockroaches and flies.

And now the most dangerous thing!!!
Power transformers in the park and water touching them may cause, God forbid, fatal injuries.
Especially children, they cannot read and do not understand how dangerous it is. They may play around it and it may cause injury to them.

If I come with children, I will not choose this park, which harms the beauty and splendor of the Tabuk region, especially since Tabuk is a tourist destination for everyone.

I hope they will re-maintain and control the park and make it safe and comfortable for everyone, because this is the first time I have seen a park this bad and dangerous at the same time.

name: Hisma Desert
address: Tabouk Saudi Arabia
text: To reach this plateau you have to leave Tabuk following Route 80 westwards and then take Route 8784 both paved and in excellent condition, Then you have to take the unpaved road that heads north towards Bjeddah (GPS of the initial point of the track: 28.306655, 35.813241). The road up to Bjeddah though unpaved is in good condition. The whole eastern area is a desert with unconnected rocky areas. Following the existing tire tracks or simply moving among the rocks you can drive in the whole area if you have a 4x4 and GPS. This area is, with certain differences, the southward continuation of Jordan's famous Wadi Rum. The bottom of the ground on which the car is moving does not have significant sandy areas (we have not deflated the tires). Moving in these desert areas among the rocks you can take excellent photographs in which the warm colors of the desert and rocks are clearly highlighted against the background of the blue sky. We have not observed wildlife (apart from some rare footprints in the sand), but we have met two shepherds with their flocks of goats and a few one-humped camels. Very interesting.

address: Prince Fahd Ibn Sultan Road, Tabouk Saudi Arabia
text: A small Ancient castle in Tabuk,  that dates back to 1559, which was built for security reasons, renovated  and nowadays serves as a museum, artefacts from the ottoman era are on display inside the castle, just outside and adjacent to Tabuk castle you could see the ottoman pools and Alsiker well . A nice cafe is located opposite the castle and the old souq is a walking distance from the castle.

name: Tabuk Tourist Attractions
address: Prince Fahad Bin Sultan Road-Front of Tabuk Castle, Tabouk 71411 Saudi Arabia
text:
Don't miss the unique opportunity to visit an authentic mud house during your visit of Tabuk.
Located just in front of Tabuk Fortress, the small mud house museum exhibits lots of artifacts and objects related to Tabuk old life style and customs. Mr. Al Hemidi (Tabuk Tourist office) and his welcoming employees will take you on a fun journey through Tabuk's past. You will have the opportunity to put on traditional clothes to immerse yourself in the past of the city. Tabuk Tourist is THE NUMBER ONE in Tabuk and they will be pleased to organize you any kind of tours in Tabuk and beyond. Contact them if ever you visit Tabuk. I highly recommand their services.

name: This stinks
address: Taif Saudi Arabia
text:
Al Hada is the first place you'll arrive if you are driving from Jeddah to Taif.

The place is surrounded by mountains covered in clouds most of the time. There's a cable car service connecting the lowlands to the peak. I am sure it is a joy for thrillseekers. 

There's a fruit market on the way down where one can stock up on fruits and vegetables before returning to Jeddah. Unfortunately the only produce that I can confirm to be locally grown are corns, flower plants and cactus fruits. Others look the same as ones you can get in Jeddah, maybe even cheaper.

Not far further down the hill is where colonies of baboons live. Many cars actually stopped to take pictures or feed them.

name: Umluj Tours
address: Olya St, Umluj 33511 Saudi Arabia
text:
All you need to know about Umluj. üòç

Our stay-üèö
We stayed in yanbu which is 2hours away drive from Umluj.
We booked @novotel_yanbu through booking.com for three nights.

Umluj Boat ride-üõ•
We booked our ride from @umluj_serves. There are different rates¬† for different boats and yachts. You can choose your timings, we went from 9am to 1pm.
We were a group of 10 people and opted for this boat in frame and it costed us total sr1000 + sr130 (fruit basket) for 4 hours. 

Keep exploring for more boats as you can get cheaper ones too, we got to know about the cheaper ones after we had booked and did the advance payment. So keep contacting different boat guides. 

Activities-üö§
‚Ä¢If you're lucky then you can get to see dolphins, turtles and fish. Unfortunately we couldn't see dolphins or turtles.üê¨üê¢üê†
Tip- carry khubs or roti so that seagulls can come closer to you. 

‚Ä¢ Our boat anchored¬† into the middle of the sea where there was shallow water and we stayed there for around 2 hours. It was definitely the best experience from the whole boat ride. Swimming, floating and relaxing and clicking pictures. All you could see was crystal clear water and beautiful shades of blue around till far. 
üòç
‚Ä¢ Fishing- none of us were interested in it so we didn't do fishing. üê†

Definitely a mesmerising experience for sea lovers.‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§

name: Yanbu Historic Area
address: Al Sur GPS: 24.079699, 38.059479, Yanbu Saudi Arabia
text: Good location to take a walk and sit in one of the shops that has either food or coffee especially in the evening hours. Easy access
description_x:
You can take a tour of the historical markets of Yanbu and enjoy some of their products.

Hanan Street Market is one of the most important commercial streets and tourist attractions in the city.

Close to it, you will encounter The Night Market, one of the oldest ancient markets. It is estimated to be 500 years old, since the construction of the port of Yanbu. It was the main destination for merchants and owners of commercial caravans to display their goods. The reason for its name is that trade in the past took place at night. However, various goods and products are sold now throughout the day.

Not far from it is Deira Market, which is distinguished for selling foodstuffs and all household items, in addition to kiosks and modern stores that sell other commodities. There are also play centers for kids.

name: Diving Bubbles
address: Omar Bin Alkhattab St, Yanbu 46517 Saudi Arabia
text:
Everything was just perfect.

Our guides, Turki and Naif, were amazing: they brought us to a great spot and Naif even snorkled with us and guided us through the reefs.
He took pictures with a GoPro and sent them to us, a real added value.
Turki organized the whole trip, bringing also all the tools, snacks and water.

They are surely very professional, but also very nice.

Note: the reef is really really beautiful and rich of corals and all kind of fishes in that spot.

name: Saudi Diving Center
address: Alsumiri, Alhizam St., Yanbu 46456 Saudi Arabia
text:
The best service for expats or Arabic speakers.

It is definitely the place where you must go in Yanbu to have some diving experience, from your arrival at Saudi Dive Center you will get the most friendly and specialized advice from the ‚ÄúGreat Santana‚Äù who from the front desk will indicate the best trips in the area or the diving equipment that best fulfill your needs.

In my case I am a Venezuelan citizen living in Yanbu who always dreamed of starting the world of diving, I received the best education from Sultan and then from Ahmed who take me by the hand throughout the educational process until I become a professional diver.

To date, I have made 11 dives with them, of which many more will surely come, each trip organized to perfection, delicious meals, cold drinks, a new learned skill and a world of experiences to tell.

I am very pleased to have started with them and to be part of the SDC family who today consider them as my brothers.

It only remains to give them forever a thousand thanks.
description_x: An approved dive center that provides diving trips for entertainment and training, also provides diving and swimming equipment with the best international brands.
